reviews.content:
Briefly, the films narrate the adventure of three engineering students or the three idiots consisting of Rancho (Aamir Khan), Farhan (R. Madhavan), and Raju (Shaarman Joshi). Their reasons for attending the Imperial College of Engineering varies, for Rancho he always admired learning and studying since his is a child, while Farhan originally wanted to become a wildlife photographer, but instead he attends engineering school because of a pressure from his parents, and for Raju he wanted to become an engineer because he originally came from a destitute family and wanted to save his family from poverty. Despite all of their reasons, they actually quite have a wondrous adventure in their years of studying engineering in ICE, and they sure are going to make you laugh. Here are some examples of scenes that might put a smile on your face.
In the first night of being a college freshman, Farhan and Raju are being humiliated by the college senior as it's their first day tradition in their institution. All of the freshman in the institution including Farhan and Raju are forced to be naked only covered by their underwear and getting their buttocks stamped "Chicken Ok" to honor their senior as the tradition. While Farhan and Raju are being embarrass Rancho come in late and also forced by the senior to take off his outfit but Rancho disobey him, it's the first time Farhan and Raju met Rancho. Furthermore, as Rancho disobey him, he seems a bit confused and threated at the same time, the then calm himself by saying "all is well". And then when the senior is distracted by humiliating the others freshmen, he rushed into his dorm and locked the door, showing his bravery and fearlessness. As the sound of dashing wind and the sound of slammed door the senior noticed and count from one until ten and threatens to piss on his door for one semester. With his engineering mind he created a device with the supplies in his dorm, a device that can transmit electricity if water hit the device. After the count to ten is up, before the senior piss on his door he slides a tip of spoon that used for his device, and then the senior piss on it striking him with electricity. What a way to introduce the character, it's truly hilarious and surely will amuse the audience.
Another hilarious scene is when Rancho criticize the chancellor of the university's teaching methods. The chancellor Viru Sahastrebuddhe or commonly called Mr. Virus then fed up by anger dragging Rancho to a class, stopped the current teacher that teach in the class and angrily command Rancho to teach the class. A second of silence occurred, then he began grabbing a book and write the words "Farhanitrate Preajulation" on the chalkboard, he then asked the class including Mr. Virus to find the meaning of the words in 30 seconds. After all of the class skimmed through the books also Mr. Virus, they couldn't find any definition about the words. And it turns out that the words "Farhanitrate Preajulation" has no real meaning and it's only his friends name "Farhan" and Raju", all of the class filled with laughter accept Mr. Virus which he is irritated and asked the class to shut up.
To sum, the movie is great and highly recommended to the one who really loves comedy / drama movies. Although it may be not as fun reading it, the movie scenes is more funnier when watching it directly by seeing the pictures, scenery and ambiance, It is surely worth the time to watch in leisure.

reviews.review_title: Such A Great Movie "All Izz Well"
reviews.content: The 3 idiots consist of Ranchoddas 'Rancho' Shyamaldas Chanchad (Aamir Khan), Farhan Qureshi (Madhavan), and Raju Rastogi (Sharman Joshi), are a group of young Indian guys that is non-conformist and choose to live their own life. All three of them attend the Institute of Civil Engineering in India. Farhan Qureshi and Raju Rastogi went to school there because of parents' pressure and social conditions that forced Rastogi to look for high-paying jobs (engineers). This is the movie that will make you laugh a lot while also teaches us in a very entertaining and light way. It has so many morals that are very applicable in our own life. One of the meaningful scenes is when they get drunk after getting humiliated by their own rector-Viru Sahastrabudhhe (Boman Irani)In the middle of the night, after that embarrassing moment, they gather round in front of mushroom-look-alike-building, while Rastogi and Farhan cursed their own rector. They are mad at him for making themselves look dumb in front of many other students. It all begins when Farhan asks Rancho why he always gets the highest score every year, then he simply answers concisely, "it because I love machines, while you guys go to this school because of the social pressure", after he gives his concise answer, Rancho challenge both of them to show their pride and get out of their toxic zone, Farhan to reach his own dreams, and Rastogi to overcome his fear of his future. "Why am I having such weird friends? one is too scared, the other is already dead!" is one of the dialogue that Rancho says while sitting between them.The thing is, this is one of the meaningful scenes. It is because Rancho indirectly tells the watchers that we have to encourage ourselves to reach our dreams no matter what, even if we have to risk it all, so we don't regret our decision in the future. Remember Chase the perfection, because perfection brings success.

reviews.review_title: One of Bollywood's modern work of comedic art.
reviews.content: "3 Idiots", one of Bollywood's quirkiest movie that was written and directed by Rajkumar Hirani, has been the highest grossing movie in India as well as the highest grossing Indian movie internationally. It keeps its consistency and popularity, gaining millions of viewers ever since its release year (2009) until today.To sum up the film's plot, the film's main appeal would be the lead actor, Aamir Khan, who played the role as what you can call as a mischievous hero a.k.a none other than Rancho, a young engineer full of optimism and advanced imagination that is proven from his quick thinking in many crucial moments. He continuously guides his best pals -- the duo of misfits consisting Farhan and Raju -- through various ups and downs of college, before he mysteriously disappears to thin air after graduation.Of course, what is a coming-of-age movie full of thrilling emotions without the apperance of a main villain? Viru Sahastrabuddhe (played by Boman Irani) or famously nicknamed as "Virus" in the movie is notorious for being a hard headed, ignorant headmaster of the ICE (Imperial College of Engineering). He is also the father of Pia, his poised, polar-opposite daughter who almost got caught in a disastrous "price tag" lifestyle with the avaricious foreigner Suhas (who later becomes irrelevant because Pia was eventually smitten with someone else, take a wild guess on who it is)."3 Idiots" portrays all sorts of valuable friendships and hardships, from the trio struggling through the corrupted college system to supporting each others' families. This is shown especially during the scene where Pia's older sister (Mona) was having contractions that night during her last moments of pregnancy, however a heavy downpour was going on as well, therefore no ambulance were able to help.Rancho, with his brilliant ideas out of the box, fully assisted Mona during her labour in one of the campus rooms. He dexterously created a ventouse using a standard vacuum cleaner as the base (along with other handy parts), accompanied by the help of Pia from a webcam and all his friends and acquaintances, while Virus stood in total shock and silence which eventually led him to fainting during the actual labour process. Alas, Rancho -- along with the others -- succeeded in vacuuming the baby out safely. However, the baby showed no signs of life after it got out so everyone panicked. Except Rancho. He kept calm, and uttered the magic words; "Aal Izz Well". The baby immediately moved, specifically kicking Rancho in the face, like the future soccer player he/she is. Everyone burst out full of joy, especially Virus, thanking Rancho in the form of giving him his "astronaut pen".In the end, "3 Idiots" puts out a strong message to the viewers about how valuable our friends can be when they push you toward reaching your own greatest potential, as well as being a great motivation to those who are currently grasping at straw; because every problem eventually has its own solution.

reviews.review_title: Pants down, a legend to be
reviews.content: The movie revolves around a character named Ranchoddas 'Rancho' Shamaldas Chanchad portrayed by actor Aamir Khan. His character, along with his two friends, Farhan Qureshi and Raju Rastogi, who are engineering students in one of the most prestigious university which forces students to earn high grades and pass exams while the way of teaching encourages them to race instead of learn. Rancho who has an extremely high will to learn does not fit well in this system, fueling him to change it for the better. But, alas, obstacles are in the way. Changing the mind of University Director, Viru Sastrabudhhe was not as easy as flipping one's palm. A series of unfortunate events followed the 3 idiots that helped them grow and made their friendship stronger.Even though some parts don't make sense, like how does someone crash a wedding without being caught? Not to mention the classic singing and dancing scenes in Indian films and the wedding runaway scene. The machine-making scene in the middle of labor was only adding salt to the wound. However, the other scenes are very much realistic. From suicidal tragedies, the unbearable pressure between parents and teachers' expectations, up to forcing the students to stick to the manual and abandon their passion. It was impressive how Rajkumar Hirani was able to portray a student's life bluntly without a facade. Mentions of test struggles, rivalry, and even the deteriorating parent-child relationships show how the characters are not merely fictional but based on real problems, happening in the real world. In the end, the 3 idiots managed to live up to what Rancho said, "Pursue excellence, and success will follow."It is not questionable that this movie received several awards and is well known internationally. The ratings skyrocketed and the reviews were ecstatic. Pants down, this is one of those movies that are able to deliver the story quite accurately.

reviews.review_title: One of the best works in Indian Cinema
reviews.content: An engaging way of story-telling. You can't leave your seat till the end. Amazing and unique characters will find a place in your heart. Most talented actors are working in this who will mesmerize you with their talent. Good screenplay and one of the most hilarious dialogues which will make your stomach. Good chemistry between the actors and you can relate which each of the characters in your real life.The film also has an emotional appeal as well and some scenes will make you cry like a baby. The film is also shot beautiful locations and you also love them as well. In the end I would say it one the best films i have seen till now and I love to give it a rating of 10.

Three idiots is an Indian Hindi-language movie that has been released since 2009 and gets a 4.5/5 rating. This movie tells us about the story of Ranchoddas Chanchad and his friends named Farhan and Raju. The story is begined by the meeting between Farhan, Raju, and Chatur on the college's rooftop. Then, the story goes back to the past as Farhan tries to remember his past with his friends Raju and Rancho. During college in ICE, this trio were dissatisfied by the campus curriculum, especially Rancho who strives to learn differently from the others. Unfortunately, the characters Viru Sahastrabudhhe and Chatur Ramalingam were contradict to Rancho and his friends threatened them to be expelled from the college. After recalling his past with his friends, the story goes to the present time where Farhan, Raju, and Chatur are trying to find Rancho who has been missing for years after the graduation day.The advantages of this movie lie on many aspects, starting from the moral messages, the storyline, its language style, and the emotions within the movie. This movie teaches us to be ourselves, never give up, face all the obstacles as best as you can, and do your best at every task. All of these elements are packed in just one sentence, and it is "Aal izz well" which means all is well. This three word sentence has become like a charming spell in the movie. Moreover, its storyline which tells us about the present and then back to the past is incredibly amazing and it makes the movie not boring and not impressively monotonous. Lastly, the movie really plays on our emotions as there are some scenes that are sad, happy, and thrilling which makes the movie become incredible.Even so, behind the morals we get from the film, there are still some shortcomings that exist in the film. The film shows us some "silly" scenes like the opening ceremony where all the freshmen have to take off their shirts and pants in honor of the god. Of course this scene is very inappropriate to see and do, especially for children. What's worse, there is a suicide scene performed by the film's two characters, Joy and Raju because they feel burdened with the education system on campus. This is very dangerous of course because children and teenagers can follow the action in the film if they feel stressed in learning at school.In conclusion, we can take the lesson that one does not have to succeed in the same way. Follow your "idiot" friends who can make you successful their way. Do not ignore those who think you are crazy, because you can succeed in your own way, without having to follow into the existing education system, as if you are a "robot". Furthermore, one of the characters in the film, Farhan, teaches us that we don't have to be engineers to be the best. As long as you can enjoy your work happily, it's more than enough. In addition, from Rancho we also learned that do not be afraid to start the step. Throw away your fears as far as you can if you want to succeed. That's what Rancho taught Farhan and Raju when they hesitated to achieve their dreams.

reviews.review_title: 3 Idiots to the world, but 3 Genius to a student :)
reviews.content:
Firstly, i will put trigger warning of $uicide and $uicide attempt. So proceed with caution. And secondly this will be a lengthy review with many subjective opinion added :)Everything in this movie is presented blatantly from the critics to the pure emotions. Making it a rollercoaster ride of explosive emotions. From my perspective, this is a unique characteristic to make the movie 3 Idiots a bit more appealing to the masses through empathy and inspiration as well as hard thinkers audience through its critique, I would say it is pretty messy due to the rollercoaster of emotions (and literally scenes) and might be too tiring for some.Now i compile 3 main messages I interpret from 3 Idiots:1. Unrealistic standards of academics generalized by the school/country are very harmful if not deadly.
Critiques towards India education system is a center idea throughout the film. The unrealistic standard of academic generalized by the school nor country are binding kids only to focus and compete on academics instead of supporting and guiding them in their passion. This idea of "good grades are mandatory practices of teaching kids to compete" is very harmful mentally and physically. Like Farhan and Raju or even Chathur who study because they want to succeed and have good grades (for themselves and family) not for the sake of curiosity and knowledge. In extreme cases, as shown in the movie, pressure from strict teacher and lack of empathy in order to fulfill the curriculum and system can lead to suicide or suicide attempt of the students. Of course, parents can be the reason too2. A true friend would risk everything for the sake of them, much like a soulmate
If we were to say that friends are those who spare time with us, having fun, study together, sharing stories, etc. it's correct, but true friends are always by our side in every situation. Not only at the happy moments, just like when Farhan and Rancho always stand besides Raju in his suffering, vice versa. They would prioritize their friends who are in dire need with no hesitation and judgment nor payback.3. Parents should encourage their kid in order to pursue their passion, no matter if its not a known occupation for how well it pays
This a recurring pattern throughout the movie, parents enrolling their children in ICE without knowing what their passion is (Farhan for example) note that most of the parents abide the mindset that a good school and good grades will ensure in a well pay job, this is mostly correlated to the economic factor of the family itself4. Study because you want to learn, not to achieve success. The desire to learn and discover things is the main fuel for success internally and externally. Passion is important, more than judgments, money, nor power.
Rancho has boasted about this numerous times in order to enlighten the people around him. And fortunately it works wonders for Farhan, Raju, Pia and himself. Chathur did achieve great success and maybe being the smarty-pants is his style of doing things, he might not be as great as Rancho but he succeeded in his own way and that's what matters.Now to dive deeper into the main character way of thinking and overall personality and how he carried the whole movie plot. Rancho follows the path of idealism (study for knowledge and not success, chase your passion, and other ideal motto) which in a way works to his advantage and uplift others to be the best version of themselves. While in a lot of ways I agree to his principles to some extent, I believe his ways of proving so is harmfully excessive. In order to enlighten somebody Rancho almost always degrade others (which can be seen in many scenes involving Chathur and the professors) to a worrying extent. This includes stealing, manipulation, embarrassment, and many more.Rancho is someone I personally aspire to be. Although, people like me would not go as far, because unfortunately I am not gifted with such genius. Though his ways of doing things are highly questionable and unethical, he (literally) saves people's lives even those who are not close to him. His almost unrealistically positive personality that lights rooms, spun people into dancing, and a happy go lucky guy is sometimes balanced with his vulnerable side (which pop's up in a more emotional scene) towards people he cares for and that care for him. Though most of the time he looks and acts improper his genius mind is something not to be questioned, a few scenes will showcase just how quick-thinking and strong willed he is that is sure to 'wow!' our minds. Nevertheless, I aspire to be someone that becomes so proud of his friends achievements for their own benefits and not mine.

I watched the movie in my first year in the university and told myself I was going to watch a special edition during my graduation in four years time. By 300 level I had watched the movie almost 10 times from beginning to end. My best Indian movie ever

An Indian movie starring 3 Idiots that exploded people with laughter and tears from all over the world. This movie teaches a moral message and it strongly refers to parenting and friendship. The movie 3 Idiots starred Aamir Khan as the disguise of the character Ranchoddas Shamaldas Chanchad in the movie who is a true studied just for the fun of it not for getting grades and scores and will later be known as Phunsukh Wangdu as his real name, Ranganathan Madhavan as Farhan Quresh who wants to be a wildlife photographer but his father has not to support his passion and wanted him to be an engineer, and Sharman Joshi as Raju Rastogi who sees engineering as a key to help his poor family. 3 best friends were accepted to the Imperial College of Engineering (ICE), one of India's finest colleges where only the best are accepted.In the first twenty minutes of the movie, spices of friendship start to gradually increase from the moment Rancho showed up at the junior's first-day tradition on the campus. From then on their friendship started to grow even deeper and closer, giving emotional feelings to the audience. The element of friendship really is what made this movie that it is today, implying the meaning of what a friend really is. They laughed at each other, cried for each other, helped one another, fought, and were honest with their feelings and insecurities.Out of the 3 idiots from the movie, Rancho is the real definition of a best friend material. He helps his friend's father, he taught them so they can graduate, and he put trust his trust in them without any hesitation. Although most of the time they were laughing and goofing around, there are scenes where they help and support each other to the fullest no matter where they are, what happen, or if one of them is in a fight.There are lots of messages and punch lines in 3 Idiots that insinuate the learning system in India itself that only caused students to be depressed like in the one in the scene where Viru Sahastrabuddhe or most people know him as Computer Virus confronts Rancho for accusing him of Joy's death. Rancho clarified that he was not fully blaming Virus as the head of the campus but the educational system in India "Sir, I don't blame you, actually, I blame the education system, sir. The statistic shows that India ranks first in suicidal cases. Every 90 minutes, a student attempts to commit suicide".The movie also illustrates how teaching methods are still old-fashioned that also caused students to be depressed due to how the teachers deem their students not as human beings but as robot-like that is only being taught to attain good grades whereas what this world need is innovation and yet there is nothing new in the past 32 years.In the movie, the self-centered head of campus delivered a speech for the umpteenth time, even the boy called Centimeter was able to fluently mimic every word that he heard every year. Not only that, Virus only emphasizes himself who made the campus to be the number one in India. "What is the point, sir? they only taught students how to get good grades, they never talk about new inventions or new ideas" this statement proof that Rancho was the only one who has the audacity to speak up and see what is wrong with the system.Another punch line from Rancho: "I wasn't teaching you engineering, sir, that you know better than me. I was teaching you how to teach."The famous quote from 3 Idiots is "Aal Izz Well", a phrase from Rancho's village meaning to stay positive. This phrase not only used by the 3 idiots when they became nervous or depressed but also what bound the audience together. Even the song they sang has its own message for people. "No matter how big the problem is in your life, just tell your heart 'Aal Izz Well'. It won't solve the problem but you gain courage to face it"

Still a must-watch comedy-drama movie till now. I watched it in 2017, and it still remains in my heart and mind. All the actors have strong and natural acting that fitted in every scene.One of the best scenes that shows their natural acting was when Farhan, Rancho, and Raju were heavily drunk, and they entered Virus' house like thieves. Rancho entered Pia's room to express his feelings after previously he got teased by Farhan and Raju. Unfortunately, Rancho was wrong. He held Pia's sister hand that was pregnant instead of Pia's hand. On another side, the situation keeps getting precarious since Virus realised there was chaos in his house. Immediately, they ran away because scared of being caught, but Raju took time to urinate in Virus' yard, then Virus' saw who messed up his house. That scene really brought laughter to the audience. Not only because of their acting, but there were also still many strengths of this movie, such as:
this movie thaught us to stay calm when facing any problems, just like Rancho always said to his friends, "ALL IS WELL,"
this movie also pointed out the right educational system, that we must understand what we learn, not only memorise it.
Besides all those strengths, there were a few values that may unacceptable to learn. For instance, when Farhan and Ranco broke into Virus' office and stole the exam sheets and give it to Raju, who in the manner of his new-found attitude, is unconcerned with the prospect of failing, and refuses to cheat and throws the paper away. So that the children that watch this movie still need guidance.
For me, the movie duration is too long which makes some people might get bored watching it.Overall, I would highly recommend this movie. Besides it has well-packaged which makes the audience not get bored, this movie also very inspiring and motivating. A lot of values can be learned from this movie, such as life, education, moral, and social. I rate 8/10 <3

This movie was very light and entertaining with the humor they embedded in, yet to think more in-depth, the film was also inspirational and thought-provoking. The movie was a story of two idiots, Raju and Farhan, who embarked on a journey to find the third idiot, Rancho. The unconventional Rancho inspired the other two to change their lives, living their lives with their parent's desire and dependency hanging on, which has been a burden to their mind. The plot was back and forth. The first scenes were portraying the present, then progressively into flashbacks of their college years in Imperial College of Engineering which stated as the number one engineering school in the country, and then followed with some twists until the end of the movie.The portrayal of how the Asian educational system is running was entirely accurate and beautifully interpreted. The scene where the lecturer was not satisfied with Rancho's answer because he used simplified and applied terms, yet flattered by Chatur's book-based response, precisely illustrates how most Asian teachers only appreciate the book-smart kids since they acknowledged smart as getting high scores. This issue's satire could advise the system maker to evaluate and elevate this wrack system where students are taught, only to memorize, not actually to think.As a person who often enjoys Hollywood movies, the iconic Bollywood scenes of silly dancing and singing in this movie had felt corny, because I did not find relevant to the storyline. Other than that, this movie was greatly amusing and eye-opening about our life philosophically. Like when Rancho said about how Raju was too afraid towards what his future holds, he said that if we are always anxious about our end, we will never feel alive along the journey. The bond between these three idiots teaches us how a healthy friendship should be. It is about how we remind and lead them to positive developments.To conclude, overall, the movie was amazing. It held a very positive message to it. A lot of people, especially Asians, can relate to it. This movie can also send you into an emotional rollercoaster with its storyline.

The movie is titled three idiots, directed by Rajkumar Hirani released on the 25th of December 2009 has a perplexing storyline of interpreting the world of love, education, and friendship. It achieved success as the highest-grossing Indian film in 2009 and collected 4.60 billion rupees at the box office because it presents a story that is so memorable as it shows us different ways to live life from different perspectives. The characters beautifully created by Rajkumar Hirani and embodied by outstanding actors make the film convey the moral of the story perfectly. The most important message is that it remains in the hearts of the audience.
The genre of this film combines romance and comedy. It makes the film even more enjoyable to watch and does not get bored quickly because even though the film has a deep meaning, it packaged very lightly, and the love story between roles that makes the film not only revolves around comedy. Even the words used are in the form of a comedy but have a powerful meaning. It subconsciously makes the film easier to convey because it is in simple and engaging language.
The actor Aamir khan wraps his role as Rancho very well. Even though his actions seem trivial, it opens up perspectives that have never been seen before and connected in life. His performance stole the show in this film. Especially the appearance of Ranganathan Madhavan as Farhan Qureshi and Sharman Joshi as Raju Rastogi makes a magnificent combination. Without these two great supporting actors, this film would not have achieved such a spectacular result.
This film is full of scenes that are very memorable for the audience. There was a scene that is no less memorable and has a strong message when Rancho, Raju, and Farhan on the stairs are drunk. Farhan and Raju complain to Rancho about why they can't get good grades even though they have tried. Moreover, Rancho said to Farhan that Rancho knows that Farhan's passion is not as an engineer but as a photographer and forced himself to become an engineer because of his parents' coercion. Raju is now the one to ask why he does not get good grades, even though he aspires to be an engineer without pressure from anyone. Then, Rancho replied that Raju carries too many burdens about his parents and sister. Rancho wanted Raju to focus on enjoying learning without thinking about those burdens because all of that affects the quality of his study, and he finally realized and pondered it. This scene is delivered well even though with an atmosphere that is not tense. The tone of the voice tends to be joking, but the message is consequential and very memorable.
In conclusion, the producer, director, writer, and everyone involved did an outstanding work portraying the wonderous world of love, education, and friendship. This film has reached success since it struck the highest-grossing Hindi film in 2009 and raised over 4.60 billion rupees in the box office. It has touched so many souls because this film did not only talk about a relatable slice of life skit but also a meaningful message of love and friendship at the same time. Not only that, the film has many memorable and brilliant scenes. Hence, no wonder it achieves such an amount of success!. A must to watch bollywood film!.
One of the best movie I have ever seen in my life..

The film tells the story of the friendship of 3 young men, Farhan Qureshi (R. Madhavan), Raju Rastogi (Sharman Joshi), and Rancchoddas Shyamaldas Chanchad ( Aamir Khan). The story begins with the wish of Farhan and Raju to meet Rancho which was their friend during their study in Imperial College of Engineering, one of the elite school in India.Rancho were intelligent students who have high curiosity, understanding to the basics of things, but also high sensitivity and empathy in people. In contras, Farhan and Raju were classified as lower students. Farhan himself attended this lecture based on his father's wishes, even though he himself wanted to become a photographer. Raju has a different motivation that is to help his family to resolve poverty and backwardness in his family.Once I finished watching this movie, I discovered a bunch of lessons and boons from this movie. Madhavan), and Raju (Sharman Joshi) gave an important impact to me, that with friendship everything hinder our lives will be resolved easily as the closer the circles the more we support each other. reviews.review_title: being an idiot isnt too bad
reviews.content: Sometimes life gets too heavy to bear. Dealing with social pressure, as people keep on having high expectations on grades, marks, and how society portrayed success as to be wealthy. The movie '3 Idiots' elucidates it all. It will make your eyes open on how to walk through a path of life with a greater perspective. This movie is wrapped with a peak of comedy and slice of life.'3 Idiots' is a story about three engineering college students who have a hard time struggling through college. Farhan, the one who takes engineering because of his father's demands. Raju, who takes engineering so he could help his family from poverty. On the other hand, Rancho likes engineering, and as he lives with a different and positive point of view on how life works. "Life is not all about grades but chasing your real dream". At the end of the movie, all three of them have their path, as they pursue their dream job.I was not expecting much from this movie, but instead, this movie gives me a new point of view of life. 3 Idiots is a simple movie yet entertaining to watch. The comedy and the meaning of this movie is extraordinary. Every scene from the movie captivates me with each of it turns despite the rather lengthy duration of the movie. As the ending credits roll, I can't help but to agree on the movie's claims towards nowaday's education system.This Movie satisfies its comedic, thoughtful, and touching purposes. They spice up the movie with in-between songs and peak comedy lines that keeps the audience alive and yearning to know more about these 3 idiots. Though the purpose is conveyed boldly of how Rancho views the education system as flawed, it is stated constantly and persistently throughout the movie. This engages the audience to actively think and criticize the system as well. They're very clever in hitting the audience's soft spot by providing depressing truths of the main character's life and therefore creating attachment between the audience and the main characters. As the character cries and mourns, the audience will certainly feel their heart ache in sync.Taking everything into account, 3 idiots is a versatile movie that any age group can enjoy, laugh, and relate to. They bravely announce the faults that we as humans struggle with, the education system, and wrap it up with the catchphrase "All is well". It is peculiar how every audience will certainly relate to 3 engineering students and have their views of life changed after watching their story. This movie is worth our 2 hours and 51 minutes as it is easily life changing.

reviews.review_title: Many values to handle, LOVE THIS!!!
reviews.content:
The most precious value I got from this film is the statement that "we learn to learn, not to get the certificate."The most devastating part was when the three idiots found that one of their friends was hanging himself to death because of his rejected project. This suicide moment addresses the scene where the professor who sadistically denies the project was debating with one of the three idiots who informally accused the professor as the perpetrator behind this suicide. This debate exposed how wrong the education system we have since most students' mindsets incite an erroneous ambition; every student learns to get certificates in order to get a job so the world will recognize them. Along with some inhumanity teachers' behaviors, this creates pressure on the students, which eventually "all students get is solely pressure without understanding," said an Idiot.Another value I got is the importance of empathy and tolerance between teachers and students. This film visibly shows us that teachers' lack of understanding can suffer students as the difficulty students' have is not merely about school; home and family problems can also hurt students. "I will never let go of my weak students' hands because I am a teacher" is the clause the Idiot said when the professor was challenging him to act as the teacher. This scene reveals that being a teacher is a glory job, but it seems underrated nowadays. It reassures teachers to perform their jobs wholeheartedly.Lastly, the value I catch as a student is to follow my passion. It sounds cliche, but this film convinces me with the powerful scene where one of the idiots said to his father that he wants to be a photographer instead of an engineer right after his parents bought him an expensive laptop for him to work. His character makes me realize how crucial it is to chase our craved career, so we are not blaming our parents who compelled us to follow their desire. After his declaration and a heartwarming debate, his parents asked him the professional camera's price as a symbol of support from them. From this, I discern that communication is the solution, and as the main actor in our lives is ourselves, we need to take the guts to discuss our desires with our parents politely. Hence, we enjoyed the learning progress we make because we know our focus is what we want to take for granted. From understanding our passions, we can be educated people, not trained robots. There is also a scene that emphasized the difference between "trained" and "educated." This scene is hilarious as one of the idiots attempted to answer the professor's question modestly with an understandable explanation about a machine. Yet, it turns out that the professor was looking at the "text-book" answer. This film chastises that most education systems glorify the people who want to be trained more than the people who want to be educated.Moreover, another side we can learn from this movie is about "friendship"The most thrilling and heartwarming scene was where Raju's father needed to go through a critical period and Rancho (Wandhu) immediately took Raju's father to the hospital despite using a scooter. Getting there, Raju came and scolded Rancho for taking his father on a scooter. At the same time, the friendship between Rancho and Raju was not good because Raju got a warning letter from the University. After all, 3 idiots were hitted by chaos caused by Rancho, when Rancho's intention from the beginning was to prove that the system at his university was not good.However, when Raju was scolding Rancho, there was a doctor and nurse who were walking and said that if his father Raju was not immediately taken to the hospital, then his life would not be saved. Raju cried and immediately hugged Rancho. He apologized and thanked Rancho.The second scene depicting the strength of their friendship is when Raju was called by the Professor of the University to help him write a letter. As it turned out, the Director dictated Raju to write Raju's dropout letter from the university. When Raju realized, he immediately grieved and protested the Director. Unfortunately, the response he got from the director was only a cunning statement declaring that Raju would not be expelled from the university if he changed his name into Rancho's name in the dropout letter.
Raju was surprised and very distressed because he merely had 7 and a half minutes to think while the professor seemed to be flexing during his spa treatment. Eventually, Raju chose to kill himself by jumping out of his professor's room window instead of writing a dropout letter to his friend. Luckily, Raju was immediately rescued and taken to the hospital despite his critical times. During his critical time, Rancho and Farhan were always beside Raju and encouraged Raju to quickly regain consciousness and recover. Rancho and Farhan continued to try, until one day, when Rancho encouraged Raju by saying that Farhan will marry Raju's sister, Raju moved his hand and woke up.The last scene was when Raju, Farhan, and Chatur were about to find and meet Rancho. After arriving at Rancho's home address, they knew that their friend's name is not Rancho since Rancho was a lazy child and Rancho's real father decided to use Rancho's friend to disguise himself as his son in order to get a bachelor's degree. When it all came to light, the real Rancho gave the known Rancho's address to Farhan and Raju. At that moment, they rushed to the fake Rancho's residence.In advance, they picked the fake Rancho's ex-girlfriend, Pia, when she was going to hold a wedding. Farhan and Raju invited Pia to run away and Pia agreed. After a long journey, they finally got to one school. There, they saw children using fake Rancho's inventions. Then they all met fake Rancho, and Chatur underestimated the fake Rancho because he was just a teacher while Chatur was a businessman. Then, Chatur gave a letter to be signed by fake Rancho that fake Rancho was defeated and Chatur was the winner. At that time, they all knew Rancho's real name was Phunsukh Wangdu. Phunsukh Wangdu was the one that Chatur desired to be his future colleague. Chatur was surprised and immediately begged Wangdu to continue his cooperation.
The moral value that can be taken from this scene is never underestimate people and never be arrogant with the advantages that we have because everyone must have their advantages and disadvantages. Always remember that perfection belongs only to God.In conclusion, this film spotted the most important but underrated value in teaching and friendship, especially in teenagers and young people's life. It reminds us of the basic value that being purely nice is the best way to face a cruel world. The entire scenes are linking with one another creates a mesmerizing impression in my heart since this film is showing us the possible moments in our life, it feels overly real for us, it could have happened during our teenage or young period. Hence, the chaos trouble that followed by a relaxing ending builds a perfect pitch to leave a great image in the audiences' memories.

3 Idiots is an amazingly intricate yet humorous movie, wrapped in a way that absolutely fascinated everyone. Even for someone like me who is not a big fan of Indian movies with all of the dancing and singing, 3 Idiots are still enjoyable to a certain extent. There are few unrealistic scenes that I am baffled with, which unnerved me enough that I questioned why I even watch this movie, but once I braved it on, it's completely worth a couple cringy clips to watch the entirety of 3 Idiots.This film told the story of 3 engineering students (Rancho, Raju, Farhan) who looked stupid in front of their lecturers, even though they had potential. Rancho was a smart kid, but unfortunately, his university professors didn't realise his potential. The professor had a standard that where the only valid answers were from textbooks, and Rancho proved it otherwise. This taught us that if we only memorize the textbook but do not understand it, it will be the same as the case when Chatur was asked to appear as a student representative. He did not understand the difference between the words Chamatkar and Balatkar, which have very different meanings.Rancho also taught us that learning is everywhere. When he was expelled from the class, he would look for another class and listen carefully. Heavy spoiler alert, Rancho's plot twist was the fact that it was not even his real name. His real name was Phunsukh Wandu, the son of a gardener from Rancho who is the same age as him. His curiosity about students made him go to school wearing Rancho's uniform. This explained a lot of his behaviour from the early scenes, where he freely entered any class to study.Rancho's iconic quote 'all is well' is extremely catchy and excites us. Saying that sentence gives us the courage to face the problems we fear. Indeed, that sentence does not solve the problem but makes us think positively about things that have not occurred.However, the quote from the 3 Idiots that is most memorable is "Do what you love, not do what you do". Farhan's dream was to be a wildlife photographer, which was very different from the university he chose, namely engineering. In the beginning, his parents didn't allow him to follow his passion. His parents thought that being an engineer was better than a photographer. An engineer salary is more than a wildlife photographer. However, Farhan managed to convince his father that he wanted a wildlife photographer. His father supported his passion by asking how much a good photographer's camera is, is it worth the laptop he just bought. Parents will always support their children. Indeed, if there are some differences it will take a little time to deal with them, but the parents will understand, eventually.The scene that stood out to me the most amongst other quite memorable clips was when Rancho fixed Joy's innovative helicopter that he threw away after Viru Sahastrabudhhe, their notoriously stuck-up professor refused to give him more time to finish his project. Rancho took it out of the trash, and fixed it if only to cheer Joy up; never mind that he and his friends had tons of examinations and projects due as well. This theme carried over the next few minutes, to the point where they were all singing and dancing cheerfully when Rancho flew the mini helicopter up to Joy's room, where they discovered Joy's already stiff body. Joy could not take any more pressure, both from his professor and from his father who was extremely excited for his graduation that was canceled by phone by Viru. It was a tragedy, and I would not sugar coat it. The most heartbreaking thing was the moment when you realise that Joy had not even seen his invention working like he meant for it to be.Joy's suicide shocked me. It was without warning and almost completely unexpected if it weren't for the foreshadowing that you wouldn't completely understand until you watch it until that scene. This happens countless times every day in every country, as was evidenced by Rancho's confrontation with Viru where he brought up the statistic of suicide rate. This is real, even to this day and age. 3 Idiots managed to bring up this topic, not in the most sensitive way, but it represented the issue well enough.Overall, as I stated in the beginning, this movie is enjoyable. It's humorous, it's the Indian musical type that some people really enjoy, and it has wonderful moral value. The plot twists are amazing and unexpected, but the scenes before provided foreshadowing for those who really watch it. It is almost 3 hours long, though, so take that into account and grab some snacks before watching.

reviews.review_title: 3 IDIOTS (MOVIE REVIEW BY FAYZAN & AZKA XI IPS 1)
reviews.content: "3 Idiots", one of Bollywood's quirkiest movie that was written and directed by Rajkumar Hirani, has been the highest grossing movie in India as well as the highest grossing Indian movie internationally. It keeps its consistency and popularity, gaining millions of viewers ever since its release year (2009) until today.To sum up the film's plot, the film's main appeal would be the lead actor, Aamir Khan, who played the role as what you can call as a mischievous hero a.k.a none other than Rancho, a young engineer full of optimism and advanced imagination that is proven from his quick thinking in many crucial moments. He continuously guides his best pals -- the duo of misfits consisting Farhan and Raju -- through various ups and downs of college, before he mysteriously disappears to thin air after graduation.Of course, what is a coming-of-age movie full of thrilling emotions without the apperance of a main villain? Viru Sahastrabuddhe (played by Boman Irani) or famously nicknamed as "Virus" in the movie is notorious for being a hard headed, ignorant headmaster of the ICE (Imperial College of Engineering). He is also the father of Pia, his poised, polar-opposite daughter who almost got caught in a disastrous "price tag" lifestyle with the avaricious foreigner Suhas (who later becomes irrelevant because Pia was eventually smitten with someone else, take a wild guess on who it is)."3 Idiots" portrays all sorts of valuable friendships and hardships, from the trio struggling through the corrupted college system to supporting each others' families. This is shown especially during the scene where Pia's older sister (Mona) was having contractions that night during her last moments of pregnancy, however a heavy downpour was going on as well, therefore no ambulance were able to help.Rancho, with his brilliant ideas out of the box, fully assisted Mona during her labour in one of the campus rooms. He dexterously created a ventouse using a standard vacuum cleaner as the base (along with other handy parts), accompanied by the help of Pia from a webcam and all his friends and acquaintances, while Virus stood in total shock and silence which eventually led him to fainting during the actual labour process. Alas, Rancho -- along with the others -- succeeded in vacuuming the baby out safely. However, the baby showed no signs of life after it got out so everyone panicked. Except Rancho. He kept calm, and uttered the magic words; "Aal Izz Well". The baby immediately moved, specifically kicking Rancho in the face, like the future soccer player he/she is. Everyone burst out full of joy, especially Virus, thanking Rancho in the form of giving him his "astronaut pen".In the end, "3 Idiots" puts out a strong message to the viewers about how valuable our friends can be when they push you toward reaching your own greatest potential, as well as being a great motivation to those who are currently grasping at straw; because every problem eventually has its own solution.

Astic. full on comedy and yet it never looses its heart. Aamir pulls off a 22 year old character with brilliance. never for once you feel you are watching aamir .It was rancho on screen. sharman n madhavan

reviews.review_title: THIS SUCH A GREAT MOVIE, EVERYONE MUST WATCH THIS
reviews.content: 3 idiots' is a movie that has remarkable attractiveness, impressive, hilarious moments and heartwarming inside it using lots of clever conversation and contains a deep bright meaning. This movie is based on people's minds that have been implanted so far in the education system that emphasizes students' obsession to have high grades.3 people who were given the designation "idiots" by their lecturer have a strong bond with each other. Rancho with his unique character and his extraordinary thoughts is a brilliant student who can motivate his friends to pursue their passion and make a career out of it. Farhan, the photographer wannabe yet terrified with his 'Hitler' father's passion, and his other friend named Raju is a person who is completely lacking in economic terms. Being an engineer is the only goal that can revive his family.Overall this movie depicts an inspirational comedy with unexpected meaningful messages so people can take a lot of moral life in it. Like most other Indian movies, this movie has a very long duration, almost 3 hours of run time. However, the plot of the storyline does not make you bored at all. Aamir Khan as Rancho did a very good job in this movie, his character brought the movie alive. He succeeded to rock both the humor and emotional sentiment.The movie itself came with an unpredicted plot that would make you dumbfounded. As depicted in the scene when Raju has to choose between his family or Rancho given by his lecturer, who is already pissed off with them, he then drops his choice by jumping from the third floor from his lecturer's window. We would never predict that Raju would give up his life instead.There was tension because Raju's condition did not improve. Then the story goes with Farhan and Rancho doing all their best to make Raju conscious from his coma. Such an envious friendship they have. Farhan got his letter replied to by his favorite photographer and Rancho convinced him to talk with his father. Who knows that Rancho's words will be the savior of his both friends' careers? It ended up with Raju getting the job and Farhan getting his father's approval and it is such a heartwarming scene. What we try to point out is how impressive how the whole story naturally changed from comedy into sentimental very smoothly without ruining the plot.The scene where Mona is delivering a baby was very out of the box that it would not come to our mind. We are bound to feel the strain by only watching them from the screen and the tension felt real. Also when the baby is not crying we got to witness the miracle from their magic spell, "Aal Izz Well". This spell was conveyed by Rancho when his friends were feeling scared and anxious, meaning everything will be okay. Their hearts get a shot of courage to get back up and face the world. It implies a powerful message about how valuable your friends can be when they push yourself to your own highest potential. Even the baby always kicked every time he heard the words.After all, this movie was an all-rounder with any elements a film can have. The elected casts were doing a very good job in portraying their own character. There are so many things that we can learn from it. Starting from intelligence is not about how you can memorize all the contents of the book but how to apply the knowledge that has been obtained for the common welfare. 3 hours of this movie would not be wasting your time.

We will review a film called "3 idiots" with a duration of nearly three hours. The film tells the story of the friendship of three people who meet at the university named Farhan, Raju, and Rancho. At the beginning of the film, the stewardess' acting when Farhan fell was not deep enough in his role, it looked less natural. The film combined with the video clip makes it different from the usual films. Then, some scenes include comedy and funny things that make it less monotonous or boring. After that, many messages and implicit moral matters contained in the film were packaged with a relaxed and light disposition (comedy) which was also closely related to social life. The moral message is:
1. Life will still go the way, must have a "compete or die" attitude.
The point is to live life with a competitive nature, because if not then other people will follow us more advanced and we will be left behind with them. But it must be according to the portion and ability of each individual.
2. Respect time and be productive.
Make the best use of the time you have and as much as possible. Furthermore, time assistance so that the activities or activities carried out are of quality and productive every day.
3. An exam or academic system with a competitive attitude will make students depressed.
With so many assignments, projects, exams, it does not make students develop themselves but instead makes them stressed and depressed because they are like being turned into robots by the lecturers. Students must understand the lecturer, but on the one hand, the lecturer must also understand the position of the student. Not only physically tired, but mental problems are also very influential such as depression, fear, crisis, and others.
4. Choosing a major and your goals must be following your own wishes.
If parents go to school and determine that their child should be a doctor, they have to get good grades, and so on, it will only make the child feel burdened and under pressure. Must be following the children's interests, abilities, and talents. Don't let them go to this department because their parents, during college, there will only be stress, depression, disappointment, and regret in the child's mind.
5. Don't just want to graduate to work but to raise your soul.
The meaning of the sentence above is realistic. It is possible because everyone needs money but the goal of graduating from university is not only that but to make a wider perspective, think openly and critically, increase experience and insight.
Overall the film was very insightful and thought-provoking to those who watched it. There are many positive values contained that we can implement and apply to our daily life.

3 idiots is a story critiquing the labor-like education system and competitive mindset in education. The main character supposedly represents the writer's voice who critics the system, but the interesting thing about it is that the story is told in a second person perspective by the main character's friend.
The progression of the story is also really good. The intro started with 2 of the "idiots" in a hurry after hearing news from an old colleague about the whereabouts of the third idiot "Roncho" who apparently has been missing. It made me wonder who is Roncho and why are they so excited to meet him again.
Then it goes to a flashback to how 2 of these friends met Roncho, the story is told in a flashback-present type way. Turns out this Roncho guy is a likeable person, and so a concern emerges... How did he went missing? And basically that straps you in for the ride, and it made sure you stay strapped in for the rest of it.
It had funny moments and emotional moments mixed in there, very well-paced too. Although, there is one thing that I'm not a fan of, the musicals. I think it would've been better off without any musicals, it comes off more as fillers more than anything. There's one particular moment that fells off to me. The part when they finished that guy's drone project and started flying it to his room while singing, only to reveal he was dead... on a noose, then cut to full silent.
Other than that the show is a 9/10 for me. Enjoyed the funny bits, Teared for the sad moments, Gasped for the twists. The moral of the story is clear, do not be bound by society, don't sweat too much about the future, and do what you love.

3 Idiots is an Indian comedy-drama film directed by Rajkumar Hirani, with a screenplay by Abhijat Joshi, and produced by Vidhu Vinod Chopra. It was adapted from the best-seller novel Five Points Someone by Chetan Bhagat. The three essential roles of the 3 Idiots film are the most famous Indian actor Aamir Khan as Ranchoddas Shamaldas Chanchad or Phunsukh Wangdu, R. Madhavan as Farhan Qureshi, and Sharman Joshi as Raju Rastogi. The other stars are Kareena Kapoor as Pia, Omi Vaidya as Chatur Ramalingam, and Boman Irani as Viru Sahastrebuddhe. The drama narrating the lives of three friends touched a chord with the audience when it was released in 2009. This movie gives the viewers highlights about the Indian educational system that emphasize to their students for getting good marks, if they get failed, they will commit suicide as we know India has the highest suicide rate in the world. Upon release, the film broke all box office records in India, and the film's worldwide lifetime gross was 459.96 crores (US$90 million), making it the highest-grossing Indian movie at the time, breaking the previous record held by Ghajini.The story begins with a scene in the hostel of Imperial College of Engineering. The Imperial College of Engineering is one of the best colleges to study engineering in India. This movie covers a story, which spans many years and follows the life of a group of friends, which are Ranchoddas, Farhan, and Raju, where they all met while studying engineering. Rancho is an excellent student who loves machines, at the same time, he disagrees entirely with the educational system at his school, which urges the student to have good memorizing by studying all material based on the book and pressuring them into giving up all their passions to obtain a good job and have a great future. Farhan has a dream to become a wild photographer, but his father is very stubborn and wants his son to become an engineer, and Raju is a religious person, he comes to study to change the fate of his low-income family.Viru Sahastrebuddhe, called by the short name ''Virus'' by the students, is the college director. He is strict with his students and his children, one of his children is suicide because of the emphasis by him. His younger daughter, Pia is a doctor and plays the role of Rancho's lover. Some of the stories portray ''Virus'' is pushing their students because of the pressure of succeeding and living up to everybody's expectations. Virus adores the students who have good memorization based on books. From this view, Chatur is being called "Silencer" by the other students, becomes the favorite student of "Virus'' and is being picked by him to do a speech in the Hindi language at Education Speech Night on a Teacher day. As Chatur was preparing for the speech with the help of the college librarian, Rancho distracted both of them and changed the keywords that later affected its meaning. It was done by Rancho to prove to Raju that memorizing things without understanding them means nothing. Chatur was ashamed and embarrassed; he confronted Rancho and made a bet with three idiots for the next ten years, on September 5, prove who is more successful among them.Rancho always got the first position in each of his exams with his unique learning method compared to other students, while his two friends Raju and Farhan always got the last place in their exams. Virus made a bet with Rancho, if his two friends get a job despite being in the lowest rank, he will shave his mustache, which he has never done before. Rancho gives them the motivation to gain success in life which Farhan got a passion for photography and, Raju was a scared man when preparing for the exam. So, Raju and Farhan challenge Rancho to confess his feelings to Pia. While severely drunk, the three idiots went to Pia's house, where Rancho revealed while Raju and Farhan started peeing on the front door.Virus found out about last night's incident and summoned Raju into his office. Virus threatened Raju to put Rancho's name on the drop-out letter that was initially for him. Raju attempts suicide instead of betraying his friend or let his family down. He gradually recovers after several months and gets a good job after his recovery. On the other hand, Farhan persuades his father to give approval to do photography after getting a letter from his favorite photographer, Andre Istvan. Virus's assistant shaved his mustache as he said on the bet, but Virus did not accept it. Virus attempts to make a complex final examination for Raju to pass, and it seems like an unfair condition. Knowing this, Pia informed Rancho and gave him the duplicate key to her father's office and did their action. Raju refuses to cheat, throwing the paper away, and Virus catches them. The three idiots got expelled.It was a rainstorm when they left, and Pia's elder sister - Mona, will give birth. Rancho and his friends were not able to take Mona to the hospital because of heavy rain. Rancho and their friends try to help Mona deliver the baby with his unique mechanism and the help of Pia who is at the hospital via webcam. Succeed in delivering the baby, Virus gives Rancho his astronaut pen, the symbol of excellence, and canceled their drop-out. At the moment of graduation, Rancho became the best graduate of Imperial College of Engineering. From that second, Rancho disappeared and never to seen again.At present day, Farhan who became a photographer, Raju who is now a business executive, and Chatur who works in an American Company and is wealthy, search for Rancho to prove the bet he made ten years ago. During the journey to find their friend, they learn that Rancho's real identity is not who he really is; he is actually "Chhote" - an orphaned servant boy who is smart and task to complete his education under the name Ranchoddas. Farhan, Raju, and Pia along with Chatur find their idiot friend who is being a scientist where his real name is Phunsukh Wangdu, a renowned scientist that Chatur wants to cooperate with. Chatur feels defeated after knowing that all this time, Rancho is Phunsukh Wangdu.The film introduces these characters in the present time and narrates the story flashback from ten years ago. In these moments, the film tends to introduce a musical element. The songs are very catchy and still stuck in my head. This movie incredibly contains dramatic twists and events that make this film look incredible with a brilliant story. I highly recommend this fantastic movie for everyone to watch!

reviews.review_title: Inspiring life lessons in one movie
reviews.content: The movie centers around the story of a group of college students majoring in engineering.In college Farhan, Raju and Rancho have the best friendship due to unique and positive vibes that Rancho gave. After graduation Rancho went missing and never contacted them. Years after the bet was made they finally had a chance to start a quest for finding Rancho. In this quest they found unexpected things about him. The scene in which they first attended a class was the most unforgettable for me in this film. It all began when their professor (Viru) asked them what a computer was. Rancho provided his own concept in response to that question, but Viru favored Chatur's response instead which concluded the definition from the textbook. In this scene Rancho said "Learning is not memorizing the exact words from the book. Learning is understanding it and being able to explain it in your own words." Which made him get expelled. This scene, I believe, reflects the current educational system, which turns us into robots. Rather than understanding the definitions in the book, educators tend to put pressure on us to memorize lessons. Some scenes also talk about the education system that occurs nowadays. Such as grades being respected and rewarded and knowledge or understanding are forgotten.The growth of each character in the film is riveting. They began by debating if they were overwhelmed by their enthusiasm for engineering or whether they were only compelled to continue studying engineering due to forced circumstances. Each begins to stand up for themselves and their passions as a result of Viru's torment and mostly, Rancho's influence. The film ended with a happy ending with a little bit of twist into it yet also left us questioning our place in this world, our passion and ambition, and lastly, our education system that has been implemented the same way for years.The film has that strong moral tone yet it's presented in a comedic way which makes it intriguing. I can say that it's a standout film because of the implicit meaning in each scene which ties the film together as a whole as a tale of friendship, life journey, and discovering one's true identity. The tension, suspense, script, pace, and dubious decisions taken by the "three idiots" are remarkable. Although it's packed in such a simple way it gives an immersive message. The makers of this film were unquestionably effective in conveying their message. Personally, there are many morals defined in this film but foremost it gives us the message how important maintaining a healthy friendship that can support and help us through thick and thin. It also encourages everyone to have a more positive outlook on life, as what Rancho's mantra says, 'All is well'. Despite life's challenges and tribulations, we must all stay true to our values, and avoid sinking into a position where there is no hope.

Imagine getting told by your professor to observe what those two words define as during a mechanical engineering class.. I'm sure nobody has ever heard of those 2 words, not even a professional engineer who's been recognised as a senior. Now this is a very clever move executed by Ranchoddas 'Rancho' Chanchad (Amir Khan) to trick while simply showing his fellow classmates, and not to mention his ruthless professor, Mr. Viru 'Virus' Sahastrabuddhe (Boman Irani) on the right way to teach pupils. This is by far my favourite scene from the 3 idiots movie. Rancho has a very unique thought. His presence in the film was blowing my mind when I watched this scene. Rancho has his own way to teach his friends and also the teacher. Those 2 words Rancho has chosen to teach them is a very sly way to fool his friends, especially his teacher.Rancho wrote those 2 words on the chalkboard in purpose to make the class discover in 30 seconds and later explain what it meant. All the people inside that class went on a book scrolling heist to uncover those words, but in the end, no one could find the real definition of those words because there are no such words called 'Farhanitrate & Prerajulisation'. Hence, Rancho revealed that those 2 words meant nothing and was just an exaggeration of his friends' names, Farhan and Raju. In conclusion, Rancho preached to the class that studying is not all about race and ambitions. If these were the fundamentals, then you'd have no point in studying but rather just harvesting more pressure for yourselves. Additionally, all the students who did not come first would be unrecognised of their perseverance, and the one who was to come first would get all the credits. But after all, what's the point of achieving first place anyway when you can't even accurately process what you have just studied. A wise teacher would never dishonor their own pupils publicly. This scene covertly criticises the education system that is applied throughout the majority of the world. The scene also teaches a lesson without humbling, because they convey a little touch of comedy to this scene. Moreover, the performance made by the actor was also very enthusiastic to make this scene even astounding.

Directed by Rajkumar Hirani, this movie offers us a mixture between a quirky well-written comedy with a powerful message behind them. This movie also has become one of the most impactful film in India by becoming the highest-grossing film in its opening weekend, gaining millions of viewers every year even though the movie has been released since 2009.The lead role of this movie, Aamir Khan did an outstanding job portraying Rancho as a young, full of optimism university student with his mischievous behavior and wild imagination. First time entering the university, Rancho become friends with two with another two misfits student consisting Farhan and Raju. A lot of things happened in their college years, they've been through lots of ups and downs. Until they finally able to finished their study. But right after the graduation, Rancho mysteriously disappear into nowhere. Nobody ever heard from him ever again.This movie will be really meaningful for everyone who struggled to find their own bliss. The scene where the trio are having a discussion at one night in their final year, with three of them are severely drunk, Rancho chides Farhan for abandoning his passion for photography and Raju for having developed a fear of failure, but when the two bet Rancho to propose to Pia, the daughter of Viru the headmaster of their college that Rancho has un-denying crush at.All of them decide to break into viru's house, where Rancho confesses his feelings to Pia and the other two urinate in front of the house. Viru spots Raju when they're trying to escape and tells him he will be thrown out of campus unless he helps him expel Rancho. Raju become desperate and attempts suicide but gradually recovers due to committed care from his Rancho and his friends. With a help of Rancho, Raju and Farhan found perspective on his life, Raju successfully applies for a job while Farhan receives an apprenticeship offer from his favorite photographer, Andre Istvan, and successfully gets his father's approval.This movie teaches us many lessons, especially to those that been or being force to do what other people want and say about you. Only our own self that can define what we want to be, no one can define who we are. Rancho teaches us that failure is not the end of your own story, every failure will lead us to success if we keep trying. His personality teaches us to always be optimistic and live by the moment also have fun while it last. He also teaches us that always be there and help a friend in need. He always supports his best friends to pursue their dreams. His motives are always to help people, making sure that he made people happy, this shown in the scene where he plays with children at the beach. The movie also teaches us that we can't force someone to be something even if it's our own child. Us people as human beings have a right to choose what we want to be in the future even the present.

reviews.review_title: One of The Best Things I've Got in 2021
reviews.content: Let's start with the title. When I saw the title, the first thing I thought in my mind was that this movie will be bored and I am not interested at first. But I decided to watch this movie because it was the recommendation from my teacher at school.There were lots of scene taught me that life is not always about competition and compete. If there is a chance to study, we can learn from many things, not just from the book. There was a scene that made me realized: when Rancho gave advise to Raju that "we'll study with all our hearts, not just for grades. Follow excellence and success will chase you", It changed my point of view, because all this time I always push myself so hard to get a perfect grade, and sometimes I feel exhausted. So, I got a good lesson for build up my identity and my spirit of study.I really admire for Rancho, Farhan, and Raju's friendship. Through the good times and bad times, they have commitment to be loyal and care to each other. Although they separated for many years, but they get along with each other again.As for the plot, it's very long and involved and I could recount what occurs, but the plot was really entertaining and relate to our daily lives. It is an extremely well-made film about doing what you love and facing your fears. The acting is incredible by the ensemble cast. The script is funny and poignant at the same time. Even the scenery is breathtaking.Although the length of the film is pretty long and has some quirky musical numbers, 3 Idiots is a delight. It is really worth to watch! I would highly recommend this film to my friends and my family. For the end of this review, I sincere gave 9/10 points.

reviews.review_title: Interesting, entertaining, and teaches many new lessons!
reviews.content: Genuinely interesting, entertaining, and teaches many new lessons of life! Especially for students like me. First of all, I have zero interest once I saw the title even posters of the movie. Because I thought I will be bored, similarly to some movies that I had watched before that resemble this movie title. Then my teacher recommends me this movie, so I started to search for the synopsis of this film. My interest appeared little by little and I decided to watched this movie. Exceeded my expectations, this movie succeeds to change my point of view and give me plenty of moral stories that I could apply in my daily life. School, dream, friendship all packaged in an interesting musical comedy that doesn't disguise the moral values to be conveyed. One of the dialogs that memorable for me is when Rancho said, "Never study to be successful, study for self-efficiency. Don't run behind success. Follow behind excellence, success will come all way behind you." Because so far, my goals and dreams have only been successful and I just tried to increase my grades. This movie also teaches us to maintain someone's trust, have big courage, to be sure what we want to do, always helping each other, and never be overbearing to other people. I would recommend this movie to my friends and family because it is worthy to watch and have a really exciting plot!

A little unrealistic (it has to be, it's an Indian movie :P ), but you won't mind it because of the way it is presented. You're definitely missing out something if you haven't watched this!

reviews.review_title: Don't Judge A Movie By Its Duration
reviews.content: Note: This review is a collaboration with my friend, DefindaIf you're searching for a comedy but meaningful movie, then 3 Idiots is one of the best choices. In the beginning, we had low expectations about this movie. Especially, when we saw the duration of the movie, it seemed to take so long for a movie. We even thought that "Is it worth it to spend 3 hours on this movie?" But in the end, we decided to give it a shot. But once we press the play button, the movie defines that it is not like our expectations. Surprisingly, the plot was so interesting that it kept us watching until the end. The central timeline is located in the present time where Raju and Farhan are looking for Rancho who went missing right after their graduation. But, we also got a lot of scenes from the past when they were still studying at their college. One of the most eye-catching scenes from the movie is when Rancho taught and asked in the middle of an ongoing class about his thoughts on the university education system. He was asking a simple question about the definition of words. However, no one could find any definition of the words. It turns out that Rancho only tricked them. And try to express the truth. Hence of his courage, he successfully humiliated his lecturer.Another scene that I think is eye-catching is when one of Rancho's friends, Chatur who is also his all-time rival, is asked to give a speech on teacher's day. Chatur is used to memorizing entire lessons and books without understanding the meaning of them. Moreover, he also wants to deliver his speech in pure Indian which he doesn't know at all. Without Chatur's notice, Rancho replaced some of the words in the text of Chatur's speech to prove to Raju who previously made himself study Chatur's way to get good grades. Rancho wanted to tell him that learning is not only about memorizing but about understanding the lesson. This is also the part of the movie that made me laugh so hard because it turns out that Rancho changed some of the words into embarrassing words that are not appropriate or it could be said to be mocking both their Rector and the minister, who is their honored guest. The minister is enraged by Chatur's speech that's humiliating him and their rector is really angry and disappointed at him. This event has made the relationship between Rancho and Chatur worse than before. Nevertheless, Rancho did achieve his goal to open not only Raju's eyes but also the other students and yourself as well what will happen to someone who only memorizes without understanding something. He probably has no regrets about what he has done even though at some point We feel bad for Chatur.In the end, after a long and wonderful ride on a rollercoaster of emotion, we find that this movie isn't only about entertaining but also educating. This movie deserves to be appreciated as an insightful and fun-to-watch movie! A 9 out of 10!
