My first thought on this movie is mediocre due to the inconsistency at the first scene when they show a different plane for the same scene. This difference is quite visible because of the big difference in size of the two planes. As the story builds up and starts with the 3 character's first time meeting in the past at their old university. Keep in mind that this "past" is the memory of one of three main characters at the beginning. For a normal view, this is a good way to start a flashback in movies, novels, or other kinds of story. The memory is very good and precise.The plot that takes us back in time can make us forget that most of the film is just a memory of the character and his three best friends. The plot that immerses us in the really interesting stories of these three friends in their struggles in the world of lectures. This story has a solid plot and problems that are quite difficult to guess with the addition of comedy that makes us laugh and solving problems that can make us sad and moved. The emotions, reactions, and attitudes of these three idiot friends in dealing with the problems they face in unexpected ways are quite surprising and funny.The problems shown in 3 Idiots are real. Right from the parenting pressure part until the due-to-stress suicide part. The main characters depict all of the struggles they have met exquisitely. They criticized the strict education systems with their thought-provoking yet funny actions. Also, the bond between the main characters are pictured vividly throughout the main story.Overall this is a film that tells the friendship of these three characters very well with some very supportive little side stories added to the main one. This film shows the friendship and emotional side of each character which is very good. This film contains many comedy elements that we can relate to in real life, especially during college. The comedy in this film can make us laugh out loud when watching it. With comedy, there are many excellent moral messages in this film. So it can be concluded that overall this is a film with an interesting plot and story with very few flaws.

The movie is about a clever student, Rancho who disagree with the educational system and persuade his 2 friends to pursue their passion. His friends are Farhan who passionate about wildlife photography but reluctantly chose to join engineering in order to appease his father, and Raju who is pursuing engineering to get his family out of extreme poverty. The first half of the film includes ragging scene, confrontations with the professor Viru, Chatur's speech and mournful meal at Raju's home.The film depicts an acceptable blend of comedy, suspense and motivation. The film is set in two main locations that are university and the hills that gives it a very beautiful atmosphere. All the actors and co-actors done a praiseworthy job. The soundtrack of the film was great with a strong Indian vibe. The background music supports the film all through the movie. Some of the scenes are really emotional.The conclusion are We're very recommend you to watch this film even though this film was made in 2009 this was a great movie it has a lot of moral value that we can learn, it has a great story, the actor was acting so good and also the quality of the picture not bad for 2009 movie. In the end of this movie review we want to say good job for the movie director and all of the movie crew for making this movie.

reviews.review_title: 'Idiocy' Might Just be a Different Perspective of a Genius
reviews.content: The movie '3 Idiots' tells a story about three individuals (Rancho, Farhan, and Raju) who constructed an unusual friendship in a university with tight competitions. This movie that was released in 2009 takes comedy to a next level with goofy singing in the bathroom, ingenious inventions that surely could not be made in real life, and dances to lighten up the mood. The plot would take you by surprise with how many twists it makes, making the viewer eager to find out what would happen next. Though a bit vulgar for younger viewers, this movie could leave a sense of motivation for those who are having doubts and tough times.The most enlightening scene throughout the movie was the part where the three friends had a drink on an abandoned building's staircase while having some serious talks about the future. Rancho told Farhan about having to chase his dreams and would regret on his deathbed if he does not do so. After speaking to Farhan about his views, he then went ahead and told Raju that one reason why he doesn't have great grades even though engineering is his passion is that he is 'too scared' and depended on his rings and prayers so he could pass. Because of this, he starts to have a taste of his own medicine when both Raju and Farhan stated the exact same words towards him. They all agreed to make a bet that if Rancho confessed his feelings for Phia (one of the professor's daughters), then the two would also do what Rancho told them. This scene clearly tells the importance of friend support and motivation. The best of friends are those who understand you and support you and will tell you what they think is the best for you. Rancho has a way with his words where he could lift his friends' spirit, even if his words are "All is well".Another scene that was very interesting was one where Rancho and Farhan changed the words of Chatur's speech to teach a lesson to their friend, Raju about the importance of understanding rather than memorising. The scene starts with Chatur, who was writing a speech for Teacher's Day using pure Hindi language. Although, due to his poor Hindi speaking skills and his will to impress the ICE director, Viru Sahastrabuddhe, Chatur had to ask the librarian for help. The librarian and Chatur were working on the speech, with the librarian telling him what to type and structures the right words for him to use while also trying to explain the meaning of the words. Unfortunately, this is where Chatur makes his first mistake. He didn't bother understanding the meaning of those words and said that he was just going to memorise them. One of the words that were used in the speech was "chamatkar" which means miracle. But of course, Chatur didn't bother understanding the word so he didn't know the meaning. In the middle of typing, Chatur supposedly got a call from someone, not knowing anything, he asked the librarian to print out the finished product and head down to receive the call. While Chatur was distracted, Rancho tricked the librarian into leaving and began changing a few words from the speech. One of the examples was the word "chamatkar" which he changed to "balatkar" which means obscene. On Teacher's day, as planned, Chatur went up to present his speech, exactly as he memorised it. Unbeknownst to him, the words had changed and so has the meaning. He continued his speech without fully understanding his own words, causing the whole class to laugh hysterically and enraged the ICE director. This was such a clever way of showing the importance of understanding and not memorising. Because we may be able to memorise our entire textbook but that doesn't mean we will understand it's contents. Just like Chatur with his speech.

reviews.review_title: 'Idiocy' Might Just be a Different Perspective of a Genius
reviews.content: The movie '3 Idiots' tells a story about three individuals (Rancho, Farhan, and Raju) who constructed an unusual friendship in a university with tight competitions. This movie that was released in 2009 takes comedy to a next level with goofy singing in the bathroom, ingenious inventions that surely could not be made in real life, and dances to lighten up the mood. The plot would take you by surprise with how many twists it makes, making the viewer eager to find out what would happen next. Though a bit vulgar for younger viewers, this movie could leave a sense of motivation for those who are having doubts and tough times.The most enlightening scene throughout the movie was the part where the three friends had a drink on an abandoned building's staircase while having some serious talks about the future. Rancho told Farhan about having to chase his dreams and would regret on his deathbed if he does not do so. After speaking to Farhan about his views, he then went ahead and told Raju that one reason why he doesn't have great grades even though engineering is his passion is that he is 'too scared' and depended on his rings and prayers so he could pass. Because of this, he starts to have a taste of his own medicine when both Raju and Farhan stated the exact same words towards him. They all agreed to make a bet that if Rancho confessed his feelings for Phia (one of the professor's daughters), then the two would also do what Rancho told them. This scene clearly tells the importance of friend support and motivation. The best of friends are those who understand you and support you and will tell you what they think is the best for you. Rancho has a way with his words where he could lift his friends' spirit, even if his words are "All is well".Another scene that was very interesting was one where Rancho and Farhan changed the words of Chatur's speech to teach a lesson to their friend, Raju about the importance of understanding rather than memorising. The scene starts with Chatur, who was writing a speech for Teacher's Day using pure Hindi language. Although, due to his poor Hindi speaking skills and his will to impress the ICE director, Viru Sahastrabuddhe, Chatur had to ask the librarian for help. The librarian and Chatur were working on the speech, with the librarian telling him what to type and structures the right words for him to use while also trying to explain the meaning of the words. Unfortunately, this is where Chatur makes his first mistake. He didn't bother understanding the meaning of those words and said that he was just going to memorise them. One of the words that were used in the speech was "chamatkar" which means miracle. But of course, Chatur didn't bother understanding the word so he didn't know the meaning. In the middle of typing, Chatur supposedly got a call from someone, not knowing anything, he asked the librarian to print out the finished product and head down to receive the call. While Chatur was distracted, Rancho tricked the librarian into leaving and began changing a few words from the speech. One of the examples was the word "chamatkar" which he changed to "balatkar" which means obscene. On Teacher's day, as planned, Chatur went up to present his speech, exactly as he memorised it. Unbeknownst to him, the words had changed and so has the meaning. He continued his speech without fully understanding his own words, causing the whole class to laugh hysterically and enraged the ICE director. This was such a clever way of showing the importance of understanding and not memorising. Because we may be able to memorise our entire textbook but that doesn't mean we will understand it's contents. Just like Chatur with his speech.

If anyone else had made '3 Idiots', there would have been an immediate outpouring of hosannahs, because the ability to wrap an engaging story around an important message is a forgotten skill in most Hindi cinema. But this is from Rajkumar Hirani who brought back joy and sparkle to the movies. Both his 'Munnabhai' films are superb entertainers that you can watch any and all the time: I would, if I could, put both on a continuous loop, and swoop in for a taste whenever I felt like a dose of upbeat.'3 Idiots' does not do as much for me. The emotional truth that shone through both the 'Munnabhai' movies doesn't come through strongly enough: the artifice caused by a forty-something playing a twenty- something colours the film. Are there no capable twenty year olds in B town?It's based, very loosely, on Chetan Bhagat's smash-hit 'Five Point Someone', which is about three friends who bond for life over shared blood, sweat and tears, in the way only those who go through professional colleges brimming with brutal deans and hellish exams, can. The kind of pressure-cooker college where kids who can't handle the heat leap out of high windows, or hang themselves from fans in their hostel rooms.Ranchodas Shyamaldas Chanchad aka Rancho (Aamir Khan), Raju Rastogi (Sharman Joshi) and Farhan Qureishi (R Madhavan) meet on a freshers' night when new arrivals are being introduced to the ways of an elite engineering college.Undies are being yanked down when Rancho walks in, escapes to his room and devises a devilish way out of the humiliation about to be heaped upon him. From then on, Rancho becomes their lodestar, both as an official getter-into-trouble, as well as the guy who will get them out of it. And then one day, just like that, he's gone.Rancho's old mates set off on a quest, accompanied by another batchmate (Omi), whose extreme competitiveness and slyness many will recognize from their time at tech institutes. This throwing of the switch, from a coming of age flick to a road movie, unsettles the rhythm, and leads to an overstretched half. This, or that, or both?Somewhere along the way, almost like an after-thought, the ravishing Kareena Kapoor shows up, to execute a skilled-if-not-madly-novel song- and-dance number with Khan. And because she plays a doctor, she also gets to save lives. She's not a strong plot point, though, and you miss her effervescence when she's sent out to bide her time till her next scene.Hirani has never been afraid of tears, abundantly on display in both his earlier tours. Here, every single character, including the stone-hearted dean Viru Sahastrabuddhe, or more aptly, Virus (Boman Irani, more cipher than character) is given a wet-eyed moment.The result is a flood, literally, which leaves the second half awash. I happily cried along with Munna and Circuit; here, I caught myself waiting for the deluge to end. The laughter in some places is forced, as is the effort Khan puts into appearing half his age—in the widening of the eyes, the shuffling of the gait, the loose, wrinkly jeans.Madhavan and Joshi come off better, especially the latter, who is absolutely first rate. But the one who really leaves a mark is the always-chasing-after-success Chatur, the southie nerd played by newcomer Omi.The film is meant to be a trenchant attack on an educational system which creates robots, and ambitious parents who insist their child do something they do not want to, even if it means losing the child to despair and death. It makes the point, but not as magically as it could have, given Hirani's unique gift of building extraordinary moments out of the ordinary.'3 Idiots' was good in parts, but it didn't blow me away.

reviews.review_title: "This is a college. Not a pressure cooker."
reviews.content: Aside from being a comedy, 3 Idiots is also a slice of life and inspirational movie directed by Rajkumar Hirani. Honestly, the beginning of the movie is pretty boring but it will eventually get interesting as you watch it. One of the most iconic scenes in this scene where the professor got offended by one of the main characters, Rancho, for being rebellious. Rancho was a prodigal student, with contempt for the inhumanity of the college's system. For the reason of being a genius yet rebellious student, Rancho was asked by the professor to try to teach engineering in one of the classes. Instead of teaching, Rancho wrote "Farhanitrate Perajulisation" on the blackboard and asked the students and the professor, to define the terms of it in 30 seconds. 30 seconds have passed, but all of them still had no idea about what it actually means. Rancho then explained to the others that he only made up the words which means it did not actually exist. He said that it was taken from his friends' names, Farhan and Raju. The professor then asked him angrily why did he teach philosophy instead of engineering. Rancho then answered that he is teaching his professor how to teach, how to distribute knowledge to his students properly, not only concerning about this score and that score."Will your knowledge increase? No. Just the pressure."We can say that this movie is controversial. It shows the sad reality of India's poor education system. Well, not exactly "India's" because we believe that this also happens to some schools and universities in many different countries. This scene shows the fact that students tend to run after high marks, not knowledge. Moreover, it shows that the students are studying under pressure, for getting high marks instead of expanding the students' bits of knowledge. Frankly speaking, we, as high school students in Indonesia are able to relate at some points in this scene since the education system here is relatable, as what is depicted in this scene. The actors' acting was also amazing and so for the plot, in which we did not expect things to happen this way. This movie made us laugh out loud but also created sadness and sympathy for us at the same time.After watching this movie, mainly this scene, we learned that if we can't change the system, change our mindset.

reviews.review_title: Satire-Comedy Bollywood Movie, 3 Idiots Can Change your Perspective.
reviews.content:
Adapted from Chetan Bhagat's humour novel titled Five Point Someone, 3 Idiots made a big hit in the Bollywood world. After hit movies Taare Zameen Par and Ghajini, Aamir Khan made his appearance as the lead actor starring as Rancho. Also, R. Madhavan as Farhan and Sharman Josi as Raju. The friendship journey of three engineering college students tells a satire about the social pressures under Indian educational system. The three of them had a great chemistry and left as memorable characters with their strong acting. Their performance changed my perspective about 'usually cheap' Bollywood films. The acting abilities are mind-blown and it intrigues me to watch more. Produced by Vindu Vinod Chapre and directed by Rajkumar Hirani, this film is narrated through parallel drama, in the present and ten years in the past. 3 Idiots is breath-takingly amazing, containing the beautiful landscape of Ladakh through various different angles.This movie has a good plot that I really did not expect. Perhaps it is because there are lots of funny moments, so I did not think too much just laughing out loud. And the plot packed nicely, one by one the truth was revealed with a comedy interlude which is basically a comedy film that was unthinkable at all. This film serves various moods such as joyous funny comedy to depressing. The disposition of the characters is well-written, all the characters have their own iconic habits. This film taught us many valuable lessons. And also there were many things related to real life, like family problems, parenting problems, college student problems, educational problems, dreams, passion, friendship, and how to deal with those problems. This is a compilation of my personal favorite quote that I want to share: "You don't need to be afraid to be yourself, what your heart likes to do just do it because life's opportunity doesn't come twice. The future is full of mystery, but you don't need to be afraid to face it, stay optimistic and positive thinking"
Overall, it is a must-watch and leaves a huge motivation to choose a path in life. It impressed me about how great a Bollywood film can be. Going from jubilant to sad in a split second, this film was such a roller-coaster experience. There were so many valuable scenes, that I even cried twice during the film. 3 idiots was just a perfect combination of educational and spreading awareness about academic related suicide risk in India covered with enough comedy. I can say that this is one of the best Bollywood film I have ever watched, 9/10 from me.

Two friends(Raju and Fahran) search for their close college companion,Rancho. After finding out that Chatur,one of their college mate has discovered Rancho. Series of flashbacks lead us to the crux of the story, revealing the character exploitation and the urge of the film. Rancho is of the opinion that one should grab knowledge wherever it comes from ;so that success follows him pants down! Rancho outrages the Dean of the college on several occasions with his thesis and falls in love with his daughter Pia,who dismisses fer fiancé Suhas ,a bank manager in USA and business minded Rancho tries to prove Raju about the necessity to get educated rather than cramming the entire course mindlessly.He along with Fahran develops a master plan to teach a lesson to Chatur and Raju,who changed his room on the advice of VIRUS(the Dean). Once Racho saves Raju's father,he becomes indebted. Raju is caught by the dean for urinating at his door,during the occasion of Rancho's proposal to Pia. Raju is given a choice either to betray Rancho or get himself rusticated from the college. Raju attempts suicide but later saved by Rancho and medicated. Raju gets a job in campus interview , whereas Fahran consoles his father to become a wildlife photographer.Thus both of Rancho's friends work on their passion. Rancho and Fahran steal the question paper from the Dean's cabin in order to save Raju from failing his exam. But the dean finds out instantly and rusticates all the three of them. Pia confronts her father revealing the suicide of her brother due to his 3 time failure in getting a seat in the college(of Virus). Pia's sister Mona labors ;later Rancho helps in her delivery. At the climax it is revealed that Rancho(disguise) is Phunksukh Wangdu. Thus story exhorts that success chases a person who is well versed with knowledge

reviews.review_title: Now..that's what I call a movie, about time!!
reviews.content: Well, I guess my sub-heading sums out what I feel about this film! For those who do not know, this film is brought to you by those who gave you the Munnabhai series and for those who have not seen this, would definitely recommend. Once again this team of producers do not disappoint! Add in Aamir Khan to it and you have a masterpiece. Not because of the location of where the film is produced, or because they show every young actor wearing a branded designer garment or using technology (or how i refer to as Sugar coating)to cover up a poor story line, but they actually use a very serious topic that involves the flaws of their education system and tells a story in a unique and clever way that as a film lover you will enjoy, yet you will understand the message they are trying to portray. Not generally being a fan of Bollywood movies due to its unrealistic story lines and OTT (over the top) acting and agonisingly long movies, I must say two and a half hours for this movie was short as it was very entertaining. Not being fluent in Hindi, I was being reliant on the subtitles for this movie, so I guess I missed some classic jokes and their meanings, as when translated they probably are not as funny, but nevertheless, when i say that this movie is hilarious, I mean HILARIOUS! Ingenious comedy not slap-stick OTT things that Bollywood is branded for.Most of the other reviewers have all commented about the movie and the storyline and actors, so for me to repeat all of that wouldn't be wise. But on that note, I would like to mention one actor who of course is Aamir Khan, this guy is a legend! Please do not misinterpret me when I say that he was the only person who made this film a success because that would not be fair, the supporting cast did a very good job and many of the actors have definitely not done their careers any harm but the reality is people paid money to watch Aamir and not the other actors and once again he delivered. He is like the Tom Hanks or Tom Cruise of Bollywood (in their Prime)who is an actor or should I say an artist who always tries to better himself and raise the bar as high as he can, by trying different roles and not being type casted. Aamir has probably played most roles now through from comedy to historical and etc and in each one he grows as an actor.Similar to the marketing tool, the Maslow Hierarchy of needs, where it shows the stages of life a person has to go on before they are satisfied before moving to the next level, Aamir would be be near the top where the basics of acting and making a name for himself have been accomplished, also making money would now be his least of worries, but to change cinematography, tackle political problems of the country, make a difference to others and to be an innovator/ a pioneer rather then a follower is the steps he is taking.This film will surely be an epic in years to come and hopefully not just the directors but also fans should wake up and see that this is the sort of quality they should expect and support if they really want to be respected in worldwide cinema. Drop all these fancy locations, Western type of life styles, bad acting and repetition of story lines instead, concentrate on writing meaningful and an innovative story lines that will inspire and make India proud. And what is this with every film trying to be produced in different countries? India is a beautiful country with many riches, great locations, landscapes etc as showed in this film, as some scenery shots are magnificent and breath taking that you wonder what makes people want to film abroad when there is still so much to show of India?..TOURISM IN India..take note! this is your chance to show how beautiful your country is, use this to show the world how great we are.And with that I conclude, without giving the story away at all where just like the film Avatar, this is the making of a movie that will inspire others and change cinematography forever. WATCH THIS MOVIE on the big screen! To feel the real power of 3 idiots and other people's reactions to this classic!! ENJOY!!

reviews.review_title: Excellent story direction and Acting..Must watch..
reviews.content: Excellent movie... Brings out the best combination of Vidhu vinod chopra(The director of Munabhai MBBS, Lage raho Munabhai n idiots) and the unique perfectionalist Aamir khan... The plot is based on Chetan bhagat's book- 5 point someone, but has been modified to great extent. The Other characters apart from Aamir khan have done some excellent acting and played their part.. Must watch for the rest of the world also...Enjoy the movie..

reviews.review_title: Amazing film the best that Bollywood had to offer
reviews.content: This film has it all: romance, comedy, drama and a serious look at suicide familial pressure and classism. It may have a runtime of 2 hours and 40 minutes, but it does not overstay its welcome suing this time to tell a compelling and entertaining story with no pacing issues and a satisfying and lighthearted conclusion whilst also covering serious topics. As long as you don't mind a long runtime this is the perfect movie to watch on pretty much whatever occasion.

reviews.review_title: 3rd time lucky for Hirani with 3 Idiots
reviews.content: Rajkumar Hirani has succeeded once again! This film is right up there with, if not over and above, the Munnabhai films. Everyone played their parts exceptionally well in this must see blockbuster comedy. Aamir Khan has now become an actor who chooses his films and roles with perfection. Boman Irani (the only actor who has appeared in all of Rajkumar's films) failed to disappoint once again.There were side-splitting scenes that I will remember for life, but I do not want to give these away. They will have to be seen before they can be believed! With every good story, there is always an underlying and important message. In this film, it is the following: "Every person in this world is born with a gift and a passion, which cannot morally be forced upon that person." An inability by Indian families to recognise this fact of life is leading to tragic consequences, which can tear such families apart.For me, 3 Idiots has made the end of 2009 an ever-lasting memory. May this film win as many awards as possible!
It's most fun indian movie i have ever seen not so much good but it's worth to watch.

The effectiveness of the educational system in developing nations is known to be questionable and can be doubted. 3 idiots explore this system through India's learning method. The movie tells the story of two friends, searching for their long-lost companion while recalling their college days. The movie rebuilds our understanding of the education system as a whole. It gives messages about how learning is supposed to be through a variety of its scenes, and what it actually means to chase the path of success.In one scene, a question was asked during class. Rancho's answer was deemed incorrect, due to it being based on his own understanding. His classmate, Chathur was praised for answering it precisely, based on the book. From here, we get a sense of how students are forced to memorise exactly what is written in the book, and answers apart from that are deemed as incorrect. This system prohibits students from attaining their own knowledge or opinion of the matter.In another scene, we see two students, one being Raju and the other Joy, who attempted suicide. These two scenes are similar to the other. It shows how students are put under immense pressure. They are expected to always perform excellently which is proved by constantly getting perfect marks. This gives a sense that students learn to gain high scores, instead of discovering new things. A system that veers from the actual meaning behind learning.In the final scene, we see the characters have grown and has gone on their own path. This gives us a message to pursue our dream, based on our passion, not something that is forced by others on us. This is especially directed to parents who push their children to follow their will. We also learn from this scene, that success doesn't have to be shown. Big houses, expensive cars, branded goods isn't needed to prove our success. Following our passion, doing what we love, is the true success of life. As quoted from the movie, "Pursue excellence, and success will follow"

reviews.review_title: Comedy, but contain great important message
reviews.content: The movie goes very smooth. At the beginning, the movie served ragging scene that is quite comedy, and there are a lot of scenes that contains a lot of emotions, such as the confrontation with the professor, Catur speech, and mournful meal at Raju house. This movie depicts a very nice mingle of comedy, and motivational message. This movie was ahead of its time, especially in the Bollywood movie industry. All the actors had a great job in this movie, they capture and accomplish the image on the scene perfectly. The songs that are used in this movie was very enjoyable, the fun music can make us feel exited and the mellow music creates a perfect sad tone to the scene.Furthermore, every student, teacher, and parents should watch this movie to know how sometimes the educational system is messed up, a lot of contained pressure from this toxic system could lead to a mental illness such as depression, and could eventually end with death. Overall, the rating of this very good, and we recommended this movie to everyone who seek for fun, motivation, and comedy.

3 Idiots is a comedy-drama Bollywood film with a bit of a musical genre. The story starts with two friends, Farhan (Madhavan) and Raju (Sharman), who misses their lost friend from college, Rancho (Aamir Khan). They have been searching for him since they graduated, but no one knows where he is. And one day, Chatur (Omi), a guy who hates Rancho in college, contacted them and stated that he knows where Rancho is. So the three of them set out on a journey to find their lost friend. The story is about a beautiful friendship of the 'three idiots' and a satire about the Indian education system at that time.There are many meaningful scenes from this film, but there are some scenes that caught my attention. It was when Farhan decided not to show up for his job interview, while his father was waiting for his son at home who would become an engineer. When he came home, Farhan told the truth that he wanted to be a photographer. Farhan said that he'd rather curse his poor life but live it happily. Instead of being rich but cursing his dad every day because he lives in torment. He responds to his father with tears in his eyes. This is a highly significant and emotional scene. His father has silently approved of his son's life decisions and backs him up in anything he does. And also when Raju did his job interview, answering all the questions straightforwardly then got accepted. I found both scenes interesting because it's the start of their new journey. Raju finally comes out of his fear, and Farhan finally does what he loves. And after the scenes, they both pay respect to Rancho, which is very emotional and heart-warming.For me, this movie is like a full-course meal. You could get all types of emotions by watching it. I love how this film teaches people about life and facing your fears, it's both encouraging and powerful. I also love how they brought up serious issues, such as social pressure, depression, mental illness, suicide, the education system, etc. Rajkumar Hirani, the director of this film, did an amazing job by covering all of those issues in one film. The plot of this film is very interesting with the background of the past and also the present. Presents an unpredictable plot with comedy but is heart- warming. The movie is also very well-paced and entertaining. Although it is an almost-3 hours long movie, it didn't feel so long and was not boring at all. There is no doubt about the very well-played character by several well-known and charming actors and actresses. This film was also supported by original soundtracks which are certainly very suitable in bringing some sing-along scenes typical of Bollywood films.This film, in my opinion, is such an incredible film. It has such a fantastic uplifting message. It is to always do well despite a variety of academic constraints. We can fight but don't forget about your friends that are fighting beside you. This film teaches us to be human again, rather than machines that can perform work indefinitely. This film is equally sarcastic, focusing on the hectic environment of college life.

We get to follow the journey of the '3 Idiots' as they overcome their challenges in college and learn what comes after it. Rancho, Raju, and Farhan, the three major characters, portray many important messages in this great film. The plot unfolds in a novel comic manner, enthralling the audience as it progresses. This film is an excellent introduction to Bollywood filmmaking.Not only does this slow-paced picture contain comedy, but it also contains a range of instructional messages. It's simple to draw conclusions from the many hardships depicted, one of which being the educational system's struggles. In one incident, a student named Joy attempted suicide as a result of the high expectations placed on him. Students at the school were expected to perform flawlessly because the administration exclusively valued high scores and numbers, leaving no room or value for learning. It also resulted in a great deal of stress, which prompted Joy to take his own life. Rancho claims that "This is not a suicide, but a murder," and that the suicide was a result of the education system's emphasis on test results, which he believes was the cause of the lack of sufficient care towards students. This demonstrates how the educational system can be tainted because progress is rarely appreciated and decisions are made solely on numbers and grades rather than the actual learning process.The film was also extremely warm. What made the film so moving was the intimacy and cooperation between the characters. There was a lot of cooperation among the characters in a few of the scenes. It was inspiring to witness how they worked as a team to help Pia give birth, devoting so much time and effort to finding solutions to the issues they faced. The moments seemed really motivational and motivating after seeing their hard work as a group.There was this iconic line from the movie, it's none other than "Aal izz wel". It might sounds very strange but the meaning, "No matter how critical your condition is, be sure that everything will be fine" is just very perfect. This word was said by Rancho when he or his friends were feeling afraid or anxious. And this odd looking word acted as a savior for Pia's sister. When she gave birth and the baby didn't move, Rancho started to recite this 'magic' word and boom! The baby started to move all of a sudden.Putting aside everything else, the film was a fantastic satire. As the very first few Bollywood movies we watched, it successfully filled us with smiles and laughter. It was an incredibly powerful piece since it was not just humorous but also musical and informative. With such a long duration, the film felt quite comprehensive. The story was well-told, with a lot of depth and detail. Not to mention conveying a great lesson to the audience, reminding us not to be concerned about what the future holds, as stated in one of our favorite lines, "Pursue excellence, and success will follow."

I'm writing this review from the perspective of someone who has never, too rarely seen an Indian-made movie. However, to remain subjective, I will base this on if as if I'm reviewing any other movie.'3 Idiots', is a story about 3 college students. Two of them are idiots, Qureshi and Raju. While the other is smart. Rancho. These 3 characters provide a unique dynamic relationship that gives an impression to the audience that any form of friend group can work. From a glance, it's quite hard to make these 3 characters make sense in a way. Most of the time it results in the smarter character carrying a burden from these 2 giving a pity and sympathetic feeling towards the audience. That may be good if the author is trying to convey that feeling. However, in regards to '3 Idiots', tis obvious the author is not.The tone of this movie is quite a shamble. Although labeled as a comedic movie. It also tackles very emotionally, dark subjects that are found in emotional, drama genres. However, it also inserts musical dances periodically as a form of a break for the audience to process the prior dark plot. Or even, setting a light, happy mood for the audience before presenting them with a dark plot twist. The contrast of this scene gives an emotional shock and will change the audience's mindset throughout the movie.I particularly like this one character over its roots and inspiration. The headmaster. The headmaster's inspiration can be traced to student frustration with their orthodox, conservative teacher. By expressing his character with exaggeration, the author has made it where the audience finds ironic comedy coming from said character. Turning to some, a traumatic and loathed part of their life, into a character the audience can laugh at and enjoy.

"3 Idiots" is a 2009 Indian comedy film directed by Rajkumar Hirani and produced by Vidhu Vinod Chopra. The main character was played by Aamir Khan, with Madhavan and Sharman Joshi starring as supporting characters. It displays criticism towards the education system and describes parental pressure on students to excel in highly competitive institutes regardless of their passion. Its story is similar to the novel Five Point Someone by Chetan Bhagat with similar themes.Farhan Qureshi (Madhavan) was contacted by his fellow collegian, Chatur Ramalingam (Omi Vaidya), demanding a settlement of a bet with his friend "Rancho" (Aamir Khan) they had taken in preceding years. After the call, Farhan faked a stroke on an Air India craft, contacted Raju Rastogi (Sharman Joshi), and faced Chatur. However, Rancho wasn't present at the meeting. The three then proceeded to locate Rancho. Throughout their search for Rancho, extensive recollections of their time in college illustrate the bond of friendship between Farhan, Raju, and Rancho as college students.The characterization and storytelling were slightly different from the idea conveyed by the title; humor and silliness were second to the film's approach to its theme. The comical element in scenes where Rancho ridicules his lecturers was followed by sorrow evoked by the revelation of his friends' family conditions. This contrast in tone and mood appeared several times throughout the three-hour duration of the film. The film didn't hesitate to display a combination between comedy and solemnity.As a comedy movie, 3 Idiots managed to deliver humor that is simplistic yet entertaining. Aamir Khan's portrayal of his character's personality provided a great foundation for the comical bits to flow through. There was consistency in his energy that supported the punchlines. These comic scenes were finely supported by the other casts' ability to balance his influence as the main character.With its long duration, many of the plot points were unnecessary. Shorter duration with all the necessary parts would simply be more interesting to watch. For instance, the songs were repetitive and didn't serve any addition to the plot after the first minute. These scores continued as exciting as they back the story but lost their impact shortly afterward.The movie provided an educational story that tells about the system that should care more about students' passion. This comedy-drama film also gives a perspective regarding a simple way to make use of something that is received regardless of the price. The flashbacks along the present plot implied the shape of their friendship and how they always support each other until the very end.

It was a hilarious comedy movie, explaining about the awful condition of studies in India. Now a days many are just concentrating on marks and not interest , but they don't know that if we have interest we get the subject automatically. It was heart touching even in parts when there are comedy scenes. Music is good in the movie the songs like ALL IS WELL and Zoobi Doobi were good as everyone thought but the other songs like Give me some sunshine were heart touching and also very good in timing during the film. Comedy was reasonable as expected but also the "AW" scenes were also very good for the viewers. A complete family movie and also a movie for the youth and a movie from which our education system can learn.All over because of this i give this film 10/10

The scores may be absent in some scenes, but when they appear, it fits right with the scene. The CGI isn't excellent, but it is impressive considering the budget as well as the time the movie was made. The camera work was satisfying, but the editing wasn't as good. The transition between the past and the present, however, was better than most modern film. There were a lot of heartfelt moments such as the scene when our protagonists try to cheer up their friend to get a reaction from them, which eventually led to their friend regaining consciousness from a coma. I like our protagonists' take on the school system and their personalities. All of the characters have a well written story and it doesn't feel as if one is getting more time with the audience than the other.While I have positive things to say about this film, I must admit there are things about this movie I dislike. The movie felt very rushed at the beginning, as if there was a prequel to this one that I haven't yet watched. At certain points in the movie, the mood changes in a sudden and unexpected matter, such as after the "all is well" song ended. That would usually be a good thing, but this movie is seemingly directed to a younger audience and I personally feel that scene was too inappropriate for the film's PG-13 rating. I also dislike in general, emotional scenes being disrupted to make the audience laugh with a joke, such as the scene in the bathroom once two of our protagonists finished their meeting with the university director. There we're a few scenes that seem too unrealistic, such as the time our protagonists crash a wedding, and then the second time.8/10 would watch again.

I actually have never stumbled upon this movie or heard anything about it, but my teacher instructed us to watch it for our movie review assignment. At first, I didn't expect too much from this movie as the first few scenes were quite shocking, I didn't expect to see guys in boxers and men peeing outdoor, but it did contain many good messages about struggles that actually happened in people's daily life and the movie was pretty successful in delivering the messages and was able to touch my heart as well. Although, the first quarter of the movie made me think that it was going to be a general story of a genius rebel student trying to change the education system for the better. Well, it was actually true, but the movie actually conveyed deep messages rather than only delivering comedies. The comedy itself was actually out of pocket and rather cringy, but I love cringe comedies so I did enjoy the movie.The casting is great, the actors and actresses played their role well and the movie is great when it comes to making personal branding for each character. We might remember Rancho as the idiotic-genius risk-loving person, Raju as the dumb, kind, a hardworker and a more normal friend, while Farhan is the kind of person who always prioritizes others over himself. These characters also show growth in their personalities as they were able to go out of their comfort zones and achieve a better life. My favourite part of the movie was probably the scene where Farhan finally told his parents that he actually wanted to pursue wildlife photography. I love how his father still cares for him and actually lets him do what he wants to do and continue to be happy.A few issues I have with this movie was probably the plot. Since the plot was going back and forth between the flashbacks and the present, it was kinda hard for me to differentiate as there were no difference in colour, cinematography, or anything between the scenes in the past and present. Also sometimes, the characters went overboard when trying to deliver the messages, an example is when Chatur delivered his speech and some of the words in the text are changed by Rancho into inappropriate words. The message that is being conveyed in the scene was actually great, but the way it was delivered was too much and actually disrespectful given those kinds of actions were not necessary to convey the message. I'm afraid some people were not going to catch the message and only focused on the excessive joke.But overall, it was a good movie that contained more than just comedies. I recommend it to students and people of older ages because some scenes may not be suitable for kids or if you are not in the mood to see people peeing every now and then.

Castings : Rancho (Aamir Khan, The change agent), Raju (Sharman Joshi) and Farhan (Madhvan). Professor Virus. Imperial college of Engineering (ICE). New Delhi. Chatur.Farhan always wanted to be wild life photographer. But his father had decided that his son will grow up to be an engineer. He was getting the lowest grades in ICE even when he studied hard. Rancho identified his talent and helped him become a wild life photographer. Rancho sent his photos to the famous photographer abroad. In the end of college, he was able to convince his father that his real love is photography and he will never be able to become a good engineer. His father relented and offered to buy him a professional camera.Raju belonged to a very poor family. His father was suffering from paralysis and mother was a retired school teacher. He also had a elder sister who was unmarried. Prospective groom was asking for a Maruti 800 for marrying her. Her mother was a really sapping character but every sad mother is like that only. Raju is very religious and prays daily. He had picture of deities in front of his study table. In the end, he acquire the right attitude which impressed the interviewers and got him a job offer. He didn't fear anymore. Neither death nor poverty.Since I made a generalized comment on mothers let me dig deep into it. Mothers are different kind of creatures. Usually one finds fear and greed in people. Like greedy people are always more fearful also and vice versa. But in mothers, fear is accompanied by love and not greed.Kareena was the daughter of Prof Virus. She was pursuing medicine and was a qualified doctor too. She had a brother who committed suicide unable to bear the pressure of forced studied. He wanted to study literature but his father forced him to take up science and sit for entrance of ICE. Kareena also had an elder sister who got married. The trio gatecrashed in her marriage ceremony and got caught. While convincing Kareena that Suhaas is not the right guy for her, Rancho explains how to know when one is in love. There is a pleasant air, whispering light music and everything happens in slow motion. It's like time has stopped. We do find people like Suhaas in our life who only talk about the price tag.When the librarian told the meaning of "chamatkar", chatur immediately replied that he doesn't want to know the meaning of every word in speech. He will just cram it up and then deliver on the function day. The most common attitude of people on campus. Nobody changes with time but people get to know themselves with time. And that is how, they improve. Chatur remained the same in more than 10 years. He crammed, he farted, he conspired. Later on he became successful. He has a beautiful wife, a $ 3.5 m mansion, a Lamborghini and what not. He boasts it all.Rancho expressed his disappointment over the system. He had some ideas. Like bookish knowledge should not the measure of learning. Grades should not be displayed in public view. Innovation and experiments should be encouraged and failure should not be frowned upon.

I really like the way this movie slips a really relatable life lesson for students lol.Also, another huge plot twist was when Raju and Farhan find out that Rachon was not who they thought he was, his real name was not Rachon, and he was the son of the real Rachon's gardener, he never really got the chance to go to a proper school but then he managed to stole Rachon's identity for that. However, knowing he went to a top university without his real identity, kind of hit me because it means that he did not study for "success', he just wanted to learn as much as he can. It opened my eyes that the true purpose of studying something is not just for us to graduate, we also gotta feed the brain. I honestly didn't think that this movie would be this amazing, i have set my expectations to the lowest, but it's surprisingly so good !!
It is a not that typical indian movie. A nice one time watch. It contains a good comedy and adressed many issues faced by youth and the education system.

This film has very good lessons for students,parents,teachers and for any person. This film tells us to support others and in case of careers just listen to yourself and go forward according to your abilities and interests.

When I told a friend that 3 Idiots is the best film this festive period, he told me it takes an idiot to be able to tell one, and that I saw myself in the film. If anything, I'll take that as a compliment, as the film is about self-actualization, or the simple fact that it's a wake up call in this rat race of a world that we live in, that we lose sight of things that matter in the pursuit of success. It's a wake up call that we should be pursuing Excellence instead, which in the work environment one gets easily drowned in mediocrity, or blind faith that success follows without putting in too much hard work.

I think this is probably the best movie India has ever produced. If not the best, then at least the funniest!! And not only laugh, it also gives you a great variety of emotions, which is why I absolutely love this movie!

reviews.review_title: FUN AND ENTERTAINING WITH MEANINGFUL LESSONS
reviews.content: The movie '3 idiots' is a masterpiece directed by Rajkumar Hirani. The movie revolves around the lives of three engineering students of Imperial college of Engineering. Rancho, who is gifted, Farhan, who possesses the passion of photography and Raju, who wants to help his poor family by getting a good corporate job. The movie tries to draw special attention to the pressure the Indian education system and the Indian society puts on students. While the engineering discipline is highly glorified by the society as depicted in the movie; disciplines such as photography are degraded.The movie tries to depict the struggle those students face who are forced into the discipline of engineering. It is a story of almost every student in South Asia who is passionate about something in life however due to family and societal pressure cannot pursue their career choice. They, then lose the battle against the tough, impossible and cruel system and in result lose their life by committing suicide.The movie shows the unbreakable bond of the "idiots" trio. The head of the institute, Dr Viru Sahastrabuddhe also called Virus by his students, tries to break the friendship of the trio by distancing Farhan and Raju from the rebellious Rancho as Rancho becomes a challenge for him. However, he fails to do so as Rancho helps Farhan to follow his passion and saves Raju's father from dying with the help of Pia, younger daughter of Virus.The character of Rancho is played by the versatile actor Amir Khan who never fails to do justice to the characters he plays. Rancho is a character to amaze people through his thoughts, his ideas, his unusual ways of understanding and expressing knowledge, his innovative inventions, his passion for achieving something in life not through copying and cheating but experimenting and exploring. He builds strong emotional bond with Farhan and Raju. He encourages Farhan to give his passion of photography a chance and try to convince his father to allow him to pursue photography. On one hand, we see Rancho, who believes in understanding, simplifying knowledge, enjoying his passion for science and engineering and implementing his knowledge practically. On the other hand, we see Chatur, often called 'Silencer' by the trio, who Is obsessed with memorizing books and topping the exams. These two types of characters are portrayed in the movie to show contrast to the audience between the two different techniques that the students follow.The way the director shot the movie is to the point. It is full of fun and lessons. All the actors played their part brilliantly and contributed to the success of the film. The audience of the movie may be anyone. Adults, kids and students particularly those who belong to engineering as they can easily relate themselves to the movie. The good thing about the movie is that it focuses on the issues which are ignored in the society. However, one negative point I noticed in the movie was that it portrayed suicides. Suicidal scenes may affect the younger audience in a negative way.Conclusively, the lessons that can be learned from the movie are that memorizing the curriculum word to word is not the aim of education however understanding is. Topping the batch does not declare you to be successful. Additionally, the main aim of education should be understanding and to convey meaningful knowledge to the students rather than forcing and pressurizing them to follow a strict, exhausting and punishing curriculum. The movie throws light on the way teachers do injustice to their students and how the pressure that they put on students forces them to commit suicide. The movie emphasizes the need to develop passion for learning in students. Moreover, the students should be given choice to choose their career path and not forced into science and engineering disciplines just because they are thought to be the most successful career choices. Being an engineering student myself, I would rate the movie 10/10 because it perfectly shows the life of students and what they go through.

reviews.review_title: 3 Idiots - Story Of Three College Buddies
reviews.content: Starring: : Aamir Khan, Kareena Kapoor, R Madhavan, Sharman Joshi, Boman Irani. Direction: Rajkumar Hirani Music: Shantanu Moitra Production: Vidhu Vinod Chopra ProductionsThe story is about two friends Farhan (Madhavan) and Raju (Sharman) who on getting a clue on the whereabouts of their college friend, Rancho (Aamir), start a quest to find him. Rancho in his college days was an exceptional, but 3 idiotsThe movie is a joyful ride from start to finish with the pace tilting downwards only in the middle of the second half. Few good twists and the non-linear style of storytelling help the proceedings in a big way too. But Rajkumar Hirani borrows most of his jokes from the net and also does go filmy in a few scenes like the Sharman interview sequence or Aamir crying for every little thing that his friend does, or the scene where Mona Singh is having a baby and the scene after that. But scenes like the speech by Omi for teacher's day, or the first time Rancho visits Raju's house or Mona Singh's marriage, helps in bringing down the entire theater with laughter. Initially, getting to believe Madhavan or Aamir as college students might be quite tough, but as the screenplay moves, we just start enjoying the movie and their acting. Aamir Khan is spectacular as Rancho and age aside, we can't think of a better Rancho after seeing the movie. Madhavan might not be looking as a college student but he brings a new dimension to his acting repertoire - a brilliant act. Sharman shows his excellence in a role which seems to be written for him. Kareena looks cute and does her role with equal cuteness. Boman Irani is brilliant, but what's new in it? Mona Singh is good in a small part. The actor enacting the role Omi is easily the find of the season; he is exceptional in almost all his scenes and is a riot to watch. It's been quite a while since we saw the entire theater clapping, laughing aloud and whistling with you. It's a complete theater going experience. 3 Idiots is easily going to be the number one movie for quite a while at the box-office and can very well be the number one movie of the year. Hirani manages to give an excellent entertainer with a subtle message one more time.

Chatur finds a rarer picture of Rancho who was not in connection with them since their graduation day did not have any information about him. Now, Raju, Farhan, and Chatur started their journey to meet Rancho in Shimla, India. In a journey to meet Rancho, Farhan is recalling all of the memories from their first - last day of college. Their college experience was challenging in every step but also Rancho challenges his college dean Viru Sahastrabudhhe "Virus" every day. Review: First time I have watched this movie, I think it was confusing, worthless and timewasting until I watch the movie at home with my parents. I had watched the first day, first show with my best friends and we critic whole movie worthless. We used to like action, dramatic and documentaries movies until we have watched this movie for the second time. Since then this is one of my favorite movies forever. One of the take of way from this movie was Rancho dialogue " All is well" meaning when ever you have to deal with difficulties movement in your life, forget everything, place right hand in left chest and say "All is well" to decrease your heartbeat. One of my favorite sense from the movie is when that Chatur gives the speech in teacher day in front of the minister, principle, dean of college including teacher and students. Virus advised Farhan and Raju to be aware of Rancho and start their new life along with Chatur. Farhan ignored Virus advice but Raju thinks it was turning point for him so he started a friendship with Chatur. Now, Farhan and Rancho want to give Chatur hard time and lesson to Raju by changing scripts. Since Chatur was born in Uganda and studying in English, he Hindi was very weak. So, Farhan and Rancho take this opportunity to changed teacher day scripts using slang words in the middle of a paragraph. Now, when Chatur started speech, the whole auditorium laughs because scripts were not only funny, however, every word gives negative sense to insulting teachers and minster.The movie contains the good quality of sounds, mixing, color contraction and animation. They have used animation of human sperms to emphasize Farhan birth and Raju critical condition in hospital. They have used silence as a sound effect in Raju sense where he jumped from the terrace committed suicide after meeting with Virus. The contrast sensitivity of Raju, Rancho, and Farhan drinking alcohol under moonlight looks pure and natural. Finally, the title of the movie intended to be funny, but also, I viewed the movie as educational, dramatic and emotional. Every character of movie contributes a lot to be one of the best films including the director himself play a varied role including editing and writing. This is one of best movie for college students, parents, and teachers. This movie was rated 8.3 out of 10 which is pretty impressive and I think this movie deserve it.
What a riot of laughter. This film is a strong of laughters from beginning to the end. I am so glad I watched it again.

reviews.review_title: Possibly one of the best contemporary films.
reviews.content: I was forced to watch this in a high school retreat and it really tugged on the heartstrings. "Perfect" is a concept so subjective to the beholder, but this film seemed to strike that exact balance of comedy, drama, romance, mystery, and adventure. Never expected this to have such an impact in my life but this is simply a masterpiece and needs to be appreciated by more people.From the acting to the dialogue to the wacky musical numbers that are truly the Bollywood stamp, it's difficult to find a dull moment. It's such a unique story with unexpected plot points and overall amazingly well-directed, portrayed, and produced.

3-idiots is an epic story of most middle class house holds in Southasian culture, where education is valued for different reasons.
One of the core reasons is to follow or become the status quo, where parents force their children to engineering and medical college without even considering the talent they have.
I believe that this movie have tried to break stereo types and to educate the audience on the importance of career and education. This film also depict an extraordinary relationship of three friends which also engages the audience at a personal level.
